description: Wometco Enterprises Inc., a Miami-based leisure-products company, said yesterday that Van Myers had been elected president and chief executive officer and Elton M. Cary had been named chairman. The two executives succeed Mitchell Wolfson, the company's founder who died last Friday at the age of 82.

title: Layoffs by Grundig
description: The Grundig electronics company said today that it would dismiss 1,916 of its 31,000 employees over the next four months.

title: NEW U.S. BONDS YIELD 11.01%
description: The Treasury sold $3.5 billion of 10 3/8 percent long-term bonds yesterday at an average yield of 11.01 percent to complete this week's three-part note and bond financing that totaled a record $14.5 billion.

title: Italy Curbs Steel Output
description: Finsider, Italy's state steel group, plans to reduce production capacity by 2.3 million metric tons, from the current 18.5 million, and to eliminate 11,000 of its 118,000 jobs, industry sources said. The move, to be completed by the end of 1985, would be a marked departure from a five-year modernization plan proposed in 1981 that was rejected by the European Economic Community's Commission, the sources said. Finsider, one of Western Europe's largest steel producers, is expected to register losses of about $900 million this year, the sources added.

title: A loving look at the films of a pioneer.
description: ANYBODY in New York who's interested in film history can head down to the James Agee Room of the Bleecker Street Cinema through next Tuesday and take a look at an hourlong documentary called ''Before the Nickelodeon: The Early Cinema of Edwin S. Porter.''

title: Habib Is Honored
description: Philip C. Habib, the special United States envoy to the Middle East, received the 1982 Human Assistance Award yesterday from the International Human Assistance Programs, a nonprofit agency that operates health, food and job-training programs worldwide. The award, which was presented in ceremonies at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, cited Mr. Habib's work in pursuing a Middle East peace settlement.

title: GERMAN STEELMAKER MERGER SET
description: Thyssen A.G., West Germany's biggest steel company, announced today that it would merge its stainless and other specialized steelmaking activities with those of Krupp Stahl A.G., the country's No.2 steelmaker.

description: Declaring ''we have reached the bone,'' President Reagan instructed his Defense Secretary today to oppose any Congressional cuts in the Administration's proposed $245.3 billion military budget for the fiscal year 1984, which starts Oct. 1.

title: SLAVE CASE INVOLVING INDONESIANS MAY BE DIFFICULT FOR U.S. TO PROVE
description: In raids a year ago on several private homes in expensive sections of Los Angeles and Beverly Hills, agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation seized some 30 Indonesian illegal aliens they said were being held as slaves to work as domestic help.

THE BARGAIN DAYS ARE OVER
description: B aseball's salary arbitration, which precedes spring training every year, is here, and its arrival prompted Richard Moss to recall one of the pioneer arbitration cases. Moss was general counsel of the Major League Baseball Players Association in 1974, when arbitration began, and he argued several cases for players that year. One involved Larry Hisle, a soft-spoken, sincere, gentle man who played the outfield for the penurious Minnesota Twins.

title: Geshe Wangyal, 82, Is Dead; A Tibetan Lama and Scholar
description: Geshe Wangyal, a Tibetan lama, teacher and scholar, died Sunday at his winter home in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 82 years old. Dr. Wangyal, who was born in a Mongolian-speaking region of Russia, came to the United States from Tibet in 1955, taking over the spiritual leadership of the Kalmuk Buddhist Temple and community near Freehold, N.J.

title: BUSH ASKING U.S. ALLIES IN EUROPE TO SUGGEST ARMS TALK PROPOSALS
description: Vice President Bush said today that he had asked European allies of the United States to propose alternatives to its negotiating strategy at the American-Soviet talks in Geneva on reducing medium-range missiles on the Continent.

title: Britain Scrutinizes Credits to Timex
description: Scottish Secretary George Younger said the British Government would want the European Economic Community's Commission to act if it was proved that a $65 million French Government loan to the Timex factory in Besan,con was subsidized by cheap interest rates.

title: Debt
description: * The American Stock Exchange said it would begin trading put and call options today on the newly auctioned 10 7/8 percent U.S. Treasury notes due in 1993.

title: SHULTZ SNAPS AT U.S. BUSINESSMEN IN PEKING
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz told American businessmen here today that after some tough stretches in Chinese-American relations over the last year, both sides ''have navigated successfully and are out in the clear again.''

title: THE SCREEN: 'VORTEX,' A SPOOF
description: ''Vortex'' was shown as part of the 1982 New York Film Festival. Following are excerpts from a review by Vincent Canby in The New York Times of Oct. 1, 1982. The film opens today at the Waverly Theater, Avenue of the Americas and Third Avenue.

title: CASCADE NATURAL GAS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
REXHAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a tax benefit of $527,000 or 12 cents a shr resulting from a change in the income tax laws of the United Kingdom; results for 1982 include after-taxincome of $559,000 or 13 cents a shr representing the company's portion of a settlement of a class antitrust action brought by purchasers of glassine and greaseproof papers, which was received in the third qr

title: UNITED STATES GYPSUM CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for the latest qr and yr include a gain of 41 cents a shr from the saleof property; the yr-ago results include a gain of 71 cents a shr for a variety of nonrecurring items

title: REICHHOLD CHEMICALS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-AFter foreign exchange losses of $1,228,000 for the latest qr and $1,177,000 for the yr-ago qr and a gain of $2,100,000 or 30 cents a shr for the latest qr on the sale of a plant...C-After an extraordinary loss of $2,380,000 resulting from the settlement of a litigation

title: CALDWELL COMBINES CHATTY AND CHEERY WITH BIRDIES
description: On the professional golf tour it seems to be de rigeur to play absolutely poker-faced. Sink a birdie putt, and you acknowledge the cheers by raising your hand as high as your visor; miss an important putt, and the most you do is shrug.

title: AT A HOMECOMING IN GHANA: FEW AMENITIES, MUCH WORRY
description: At the trade fair here, by a lagoon on the Atlantic, there is a new commerce these days that deals in the hundreds of thousands of Ghanaians who have been expelled from Nigeria and have struggled across two countries to come home.

title: Ring Debut at 61
description: When Arthur Boynton squares off against Randy Corey in a heavyweight bout in Burlington, Vt., tomorrow night, it will be ''the fight of the century.'' That assessment - by Bernard Cummings, the chairman of the Vermont State Boxing Control Commission - may seem unusual for a subnovice bout in a Golden Gloves tournament sponsored by the Burlington Boys Club.

title: Judge Dismisses the Case Of Infant Allowed to Die
description: The Indiana Court of Appeals today dismissed the case of a retarded and handicapped baby boy whose parents withheld medical treatment, ruling that his death made the legal issues moot.

title: DETROIT OFFICIAL INDICTED IN U.S. INQUIRY ON BRIBERY
description: The director of the city's water and sewer department was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on charges of taking more than $16,000 in bribes to channel contracts to favored businesses.

title: DOW CHEMICAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a gain of $57 million from an exchange of debt for equity

title: Washington State 87
description: LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kenny Fields scored 9 of his 26 points in overtime to lead U.C.L.A. over Washington State in a Pacific 10 game.

title: Australians to Vote In March, 9 Months Early
description: Prime Minister Malcolm Fraser announced today that he was calling national elections for March 5, nine months ahead of schedule.

title: RECITAL: MUSIC OF THE BAROQUE
description: THE Baroque chamber group Musical Offering is one of a growing number of ensembles whose playing might be labeled ''postauthentic.'' For the members of Music Hall Offering have done their musicological research and done it well, but their performances have no trace of self-conscious, museumlike mustiness.

title: COLONIAL LIFE & ACCIDENT INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Nassau Foresees $50 Million Deficit
description: Nassau County had a $36.7 million operating deficit in 1982 - the largest in its 83-year history - and may face a $50 million deficit by Dec. 31, the County Comptroller said today.

title: MOTOROLA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes an extraordinary gain of $8,500,000 from the exchange of stock for outstndg debentures; the yr-ago results have been restated to include the acquisition of Four-Phase Systems Inc in Mar

title: THEATER: ARTHUR MILLER'S 'VIEW FROM THE BRIDGE'
description: IT'S thrilling to watch two long-estranged old friends come to one another's rescue in their hour of darkest need. And, in a figurative sense, that's just what is happening this moment at the Ambassador Theater. The two old friends I refer to are Arthur Miller and Broadway. Mr. Miller hasn't had a success in a Broadway house for well over a decade. Broadway is in the midst of its leanest season in years. But thanks to the stunning revival of ''A View From the Bridge'' that opened last night, Mr. Miller has found a haven on Broadway again, and Broadway has found a much-needed evening of electric American drama. I hope no one wakes us up and tells us that this is all a dream.

title: WASHINGTON POST CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
A BUFFALO SUBURB TO RECEIVE U.S. AID
description: The Reagan Administration said today that it would grant $1.9 million in Federal assistance to the Buffalo suburb of Lackawanna, where 7,300 workers are expected to be laid off by the closing of a Bethlehelm Steel Corporation plant.

title: AMERICAN SCIENCE & ENGINEERING INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: B-Net income including credits from discontinued operations of $55,000 for the qr and $108,000 for the 9 mos

title: Let Germany Vote on Wurst
description: The West German people are trying to hold an election that can turn, as democratic elections usually do, on sausage prices and leadership styles. But Soviet and American leaders keep insisting it's a plebiscite on whether their missiles in Europe should number 200, 75 or zero. These are reckless intrusions.

title: PARTNERSHIP FOR THE CITY MELDS IDEAS
description: When David Rockefeller decided in 1979 to try to harmonize the varied civic voices of the New York City business community, McKinsey & Company, the management consultants, did a study.

title: PROBLEMS IN PROMOTING DEMOCRACY
description: The Reagan Administration's public campaign to promote democracy, announced with great fanfare by the President last June, has been embroiled in a bureaucratic tussle over funding and the question of whether the Central Intelligence Agency should have a significant role.

title: ARTISTS AND SCHOLARS PUT BLACK HISTORY ON VIEW
description: This weekend, at the start of observances across the country of Black History Month, New Yorkers will have a rare chance to see how black artists, musicians and historians interpret the black experience in America.

title: THE EVENING HOURS
description: ''O H do let's phone Ethel and tell her to come on down,'' Carol Channing was saying the other evening after she and Geraldine Stutz had delightedly swapped their umpteenth show-business anecdote about the legendary Miss Merman.

title: UNIVERSAL LEAF TOBACCO CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Ex-Agent's Case Rests In Smuggling Trial
description: Edwin P. Wilson, a former agent of the Central Intelligence Agency, helped smuggle Libyan atomic bomb plans to Washington as a show of ''good faith'' in a plea bargain, a defense witness asserted today in Mr. Wilson's trial.

title: Reuschel Healing
description: In nine full seasons in the major leagues, Rick Reuschel had averaged 34 starts a year. Last year, an injury to his right shoulder early in spring training knocked him out for the season and jeopardized his future.

title: THEATER: 'LITTLE VICTORIES,' TRAVAILS OF WOMEN
description: IN Lavonne Mueller's imaginative new play, ''Little Victories,'' Susan B. Anthony meets Joan of Arc as each is embarking on her career. They talk about woman's suffrage, women's suffering and the men in their lives. The method is similar to that in the first scene of Caryl Churchill's ''Top Girls,'' in which famous women of art and history exchange ideas and items of biography. One difference is that in ''Little Victories,'' we watch the characters actively contest male domination -and win.

title: Plan by Chrysler
description: The Chrysler Corporation said its directors had approved a plan, announced in January, to issue common stock for $1.1 billion worth of preferred stock held by banks and other financial institutions. The plan, subject to shareholder and other approvals, would allow Chrysler to wipe off its books the $1.1 billion in debt by issuing common stock worth more than $450 million.

title: RECITAL: NATAN BRAND, PIANIST
description: IMMEDIATELY following the wistful, elegiac middle section of the well-known ''Marche funebre'' movement of Chopin's Sonata No. 2 in B-flat minor, the pianist Natan Brand turned to the audience in Alice Tully Hall Tuesday night, dramatically lifted his arm and furiously pounded out the funeral dirge. It was a gesture made for shock and effect, uncalled for in the score; it was an extreme example of the extent to which Mr. Brand continuously called attention to the details of his playing at the expense of the music.

title: CARDINAL SAMORE VATICAN MEDIATOR
description: Antonio Cardinal Samore, a specialist in Latin American affairs and the papal mediator in a divisive dispute between Argentina and Chile, died here today after a heart attack. He was 77 years old and a native of Italy.

title: NO. 2 BENDIX EXECUTIVE REPORTEDLY FORCED OUT
description: Alonzo L. McDonald Jr., the former White House staff director in the Carter Administration who has been president of the Bendix Corporation for the last 18 months, has been abruptly forced out of his $740,000 job, Wall Street sources disclosed yesterday.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I just ran up onto the lead tank and grabbed and said, 'Stop your tanks.'

title: Funds' Assets Decline Again
description: Assets of the nation's money market funds fell $2 billion in the week ended Wednesday, the Investment Company Institute said yesterday. It was the ninth consecutive decline, and brought the total assets to $197.4 billion, the lowest level since May 19.

title: SCIENTISTS DEVELOP NEW TEST TO DIAGNOSE V.D. IN MINUTES
description: Scientists have developed tests for three major venereal diseases, using new monoclonal antibodies that reduce from days to minutes the time it takes to identify such infections, according to a report published today.

title: U.S.F.L. Gets Davis
description: Anthony Davis became a four-league man yesterday when the former running back from Southern California signed on with the Los Angeles Express of the new United States Football League. After Davis left U.S.C. in 1975, he went to the Southern California Sun of the World Football League for one season, spent another with the Toronto Argonauts of the Canadian Football League then joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers of the National Football league in 1977. He also played for Houston and the Los Angeles Rams in the N.F.L.

title: 'WINDS OF WAR' STIRS THE COMPETITION
description: THIS is the weekend that begins the widely heralded, weeklong presentation of ''The Winds of War,'' Herman Wouk's adaptation of his best-selling 1971 novel. It begins at 8 P.M. on Sunday on Channel 7 and it will consume 18 hours of air time. This being network television, three of those hours will be filled with commercials.

title: MOORE PRODUCTS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Royal Shakespeare to open 'All's Well' at Martin Beck.
description: THE saga of the Royal Shakespeare Company's acclaimed production of ''All's Well That Ends Well'' has a happy ending: It will come to Broadway this spring, after all. Months ago, the Shubert Organization announced that the production would open in New York in April. But it was suddenly canceled a few weeks ago because of a dispute involving television rights. The problem was resolved just as suddenly this week, and ''All's Well That Ends Well'' has been booked into the Martin Beck Theater for a limited 10-week run, beginning April 9.

title: Accord Reported On a Garage Pact
description: The owners of 500 parking garages in Manhattan and the Bronx have reached a tentative agreement with their 3,000 employees on a new three-year contract, the two sides announced yesterday.

title: ART: ILYA BOLOTOWSKY
description: ILYA BOLOTOWSKY died two years ago at the age of 74. He left behind a body of work that, after a phase of biomorphism during the 1930's, never departed from the geometric. A selection of his art is on view at both branches of the Washburn Gallery, with canvases from 1948 to 1951 at 42 East 57th Street, and late works downtown at 113 Greene Street.

title: GENERAL PUBLIC UTILITIES CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-After gain of $3,026,000 from reversal of depreciation on Three Mile Island Unit I, gain of $4,610,000 from reversal of expenses incurred for public health and safety and restart of Three Mile Island Unit I, and writeoff of $3,863,000 ofinvestment in Ontario Hydro Project...C-Net loss after $30,805,000 writeoff of the excess of G.P.U.'s investments in its subsidiaries over their related net assets gain of $18,670,000 from reversal of depreciation on Three Mile Island UnitI, and charge of $26,943,000 related to abdonment of Forked River Nuclear Proj

title: HOW A SMALL MUSEUM PUTS ON ITS BIG SHOWS
description: THE director calls his own museum ''the best-kept secret in New York.'' Few people go there. A lot of people don't know what's in it. Some people have never even heard of it. This hidden treasure - whose keepers of the recent past and present have been pushing to get it on the map - is the New-York Historical Society at Central Park West and 77th Street. A museum of American history and art whose scope now goes beyond the city and even beyond New York State, it was founded in 1804, 66 years before the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Thomas Jefferson and James Monroe were among its earliest members.

title: FRIDAY, FEBRUARY 4, 1983; The Economy
description: Major retailers reported strong sales gains in January, apparently because of good weather and heavy promotion. Sears's sales were up 5.5 percent, while K Mart's rose 2 percent and J.C. Penney's 9.2 percent. Analysts said the gains could be the consumer spending rise many see as the key to recovery. But they noted that January sales a year ago were especially weak. (Page D1.)

title: No Headline
description: Venture Talks By Harvester

title: Required Reading
description: Most Important Skills

title: THOMAS & BETTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Phil Berg, 80, Talent Agent, Pioneered Movie Packages
description: LOS ANGELES (AP) - Phil Berg, a pioneering talent agent who handled such clients as Clark Gable, Judy Garland and Joan Crawford, died Tuesday.

title: She's 'Old' at 23
description: She is not exactly on her last legs, but at age 23 Kathy Johnson is a geriatric marvel in the teen-age world of gymnastics. Of the six women and two alternates on the United States national elite team, the next oldest is 18.

title: Patricia Wildermuth, Directed Butterick Sewing Publication
description: Patricia Wildermuth, former editorial director of Butterick Patterns, a sewing publication of the Butterick Fashion Marketing Company, died of cancer Tuesday at Presbyterian Hospital. She was 45 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Miss Plummer to Read
description: Amanda Plummer, who recently left the Broadway cast of ''Agnes of God,'' will give a free reading from a new play tomorrow at 1 P.M. at the Greene Street Cafe, 109 Greene Street. The reading, second in a series of eight called ''New Voices,'' is from the play ''Lee Harvey Oswald'' by Michael Hastings.

title: CACI INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings reflect a 200 percent stock divd paid in Dec 1982

title: POPE PLOT TRIAL IS LIKELY IN '83
description: The magistrate investigating the shooting of Pope John Paul II said today that the trial of Bulgarians and Turks accused of complicity should begin by the end of the year.

title: Joe Kearney, Ex-Slave; Age Put at About 124
description: Joe Kearney, a former slave who began his life on a plantation in Mississippi and said he recalled the day Union troops arrived to announce the end of slavery, has died.

title: A GUIDE TO THE LAST GREAT JUKEBOXES IN TOWN
description: A WAR is on in the spacious bar area of the Century Cafe on West 43d Street, and nobody is about to concede defeat. The young man at the end of the bar has been punching up vintage rock-and-roll on the glittering jukebox in the corner while he waits for his date - ''Be Bop a Lula'' by Gene Vincent or Otis Redding demanding ''Respect.'' But for the middle-aged suburban couple sitting at the window and watching the last of the rush-hour crowd hurry by, swing's the thing, and the husband has been making periodic visits to the jukebox to play Benny Goodman's ''And the Angels Sing'' or Tommy Dorsey's ''Song of India.''

title: Clashes Lead to Curfew in Parts of Indian State
description: The Indian authorities imposed an indefinite curfew in parts of Assam, a northeastern state, after seven people were killed in clashes between the police and protesters, state officials said today. It was the first major eruption of violence between government forces and protesters who have threatened to block statewide elections scheduled for this month as part of a drive against illegal immigrants from neighboring Bangladesh. Army troops were ordered in Thursday night to curb the violence.

title: INTECOM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After extraordinary credits for the qr and yr...C-Net loss

title: CANADA PERMANENT MORTGAGE CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-Including income of $5,358,000 for the latest yr and $13,745,000 for the previous yr on the sale of securities and other nonrecurring items, Canada PermanentMortgage is a unit of Genstar Corp

title: GREAT LAKES FOREST PRODUCTS LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net income; the company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges

title: GRANT INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CUOMO SEEKING CUT IN TAX HELP FOR BUSINESSES
description: Governor Cuomo is seeking to reduce or eliminate some major tax breaks for business and use the savings to reduce the corporate tax rate, aides to the Governor said today.

title: 120,000 SECRET BALLOTS ON BIRTH CONTROL
description: To the Editor:

title: DAYLIGHT TRUCKING HELPS TO OFFSET IMPACT OF STRIKE
description: The nationwide strike of independent truck drivers entered its fourth day yesterday with no major disruptions of commerce reported. In response to several hundred incidents of violence, the number of trucks on the roads after dark was said to have decreased sharply. More trucks were heading for market in the daylight hours, many of them traveling in convoys for protection.

title: CARRUTHERSES WIN 3D U.S. TITLE IN ROW
description: Kitty and Peter Carruthers, a sister and brother team from Wilmington, Del., brilliantly demonstrated the art of ice skating harmony tonight as they won the championship pairs competition for the third straight year in the United States Figure Skating Championships at the Civic Arena.

title: EXECUTIVES
description: * Emhart Corp. elected J. Michael Stepp treasurer.

title: BRIEFING
description: Take Another Look

title: Hanoi Pressing Attack On Cambodian Rebels
description: Vietnamese troops pressed their attack today for a fourth day against anti-Communist Cambodian forces on the Cambodian side of the border with Thailand.

title: Military Analysis
description: Many officers at the vast military complex here say they are perplexed over why the United States Marines are still in Lebanon. A naval officer said the Americans, who were taken from the Marine Amphibious Unit stationed in the Mediterranean, represented ''the only floating reserve we have in a very explosive area.''

title: U.S. Drops Phone Bid
description: The Justice Department, in an unexpected turnabout, withdrew a court appeal today that had been a major roadblock to introduction of a new type of mobile telephone service.

title: Fontes Joins Giants
description: Len Fontes has been named defensive backfield coach for the Giants, the post he had for three years with the Cleveland Browns. He replaces Fred Glick. Of the nine Giants assistants under Ray Perkins last season, Coach Bill Parcells has now retained or replaced all but Bob Lord, the offensive line coach.

title: Economic Scene; Reagan Policy 2 Years Later
description: IS President Reagan abandoning the economic policies with which he took office - huge ''supply side'' tax cuts to stimulate investment and economic growth, cuts in social spending, a rapid military buildup and an anti-inflationary monetary policy targeted on the monetary aggregates? Or, as he insisted during the 1982 off-year election campaign, does he mean to ''stay the course''?

title: MOHAWK RUBBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ISLANDERS TROUNCE DEVILS
description: It took more than half a game, but the superiority of the Islanders over the Devils eventually emerged in a 7-2 victory before a crowd of 15,033 at Byrne Meadowlands Arena.

title: HEILEMAN, G, BREWING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Friday; WASHINGTON IRVING AT 200
description: Two hundred years after his birth, the creator of Rip Van Winkle and Ichabod Crane - Washington Irving - is being honored with an exhibition at Columbia University, Broadway and 116th Street. More than 100 items reflecting Irving's development as a literary and public figure will be on display today through March 17 in the rotunda of Low Memorial Library and then through May in Columbia's Butler Library. Manuscripts of Irving's unpublished ''Chronicles of the Ommiades'' can be seen, for instance, along with first editions, the ambassadorial sword Irving wore as Minister to Spain, portraits of him and original illustrations for his books. 3 PLAYS IN THE SANCTUARY

title: FRIDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Chicago Bulls, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, East Rutherford, N.J., 7:35 P.M. The game features two players chosen for the National Basketball Association All-Star Game: Buck Williams of the Nets and Reggie Theus of the Bulls. (Television - SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WVNJ, 620; 7:30 P.M.) Knicks vs. Mavericks, at Dallas. After a shot by Jay Vincent at the final buzzer beat Los Angeles on Wednesday night, the Mavericks had won 9 of their last 11 games. (Television - Channel 9, 8:30 P.M.) College Games: Princeton at Columbia, 7:30 P.M. (Radio - WKCR-FM, 89.9; 7:30 P.M.); Fairleigh Dickinson at Brooklyn, 8 P.M.; John Jay at Vassar, 8 P.M.; L.I.U. at Robert Morris, 8 P.M.; Stony Brook at Oneonta State, 8:30 P.M. Boxing Alberto Mercado vs. Juan Veloz, junior featherweights; Terry Silver vs. Rafael Ortiz, lightweights, and Kevin Moley vs. Jesus (Pecho) Castro, junior middleweights, 10-round co-feature bouts, at Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street; first preliminary, 7:30 P.M. (Television -MSG Cable, 7:30 P.M., live, and 1 A.M., tape.)

title: More Mortgages To Back Securities
description: The market for securities backed by home mortgages is being extended, the Department of Housing and Urban Development announced.

title: Charges at Yale To Rise by 10.1%
description: Yale University announced today that it would raise total charges for undergraduates by 10.1 percent, to $12,980, for the 1983-84 school year.

title: FEAR RIES IN CABS OF NONSTRIKING TRUCKERS
description: Trucks are traveling in packs, sometimes led by police cars. Officers shine searchlights on each overpass as the convoys move ahead, looking for people who might throw a brick or take a shot at a truck.

title: Mime in Queens
description: Mummenschanz, the European mime troupe that creates a variety of characters and situations with a minimum of props, will be on stage Sunday at 3 P.M. at Queens College's Colden Center for the Performing Arts, Kissena Boulevard and the Long Island Expressway.

title: LIVE FROM NEW YORK, IT'S THE NEW SID CAESAR
description: It was terrible vaudeville dialect: ''You vant to know vy your rrrratings is low? I vill egsplain vy to you.'' Terrible perhaps, but unmistakable. True, there was no sign of Imogene Coca or Carl Reiner or Howard Morris, but the big man mugging and rolling his eyes and his r's in the middle of the room could be only one person. It was Sid Caesar.

title: 'WITHOUT A TRACE'
description: DURING the nerve-racking opening moments of ''Without a Trace,'' the audience waits for the very worst to happen. A charming little blond-haired boy - who, lest the point be lost, looks quite a bit like Etan Patz -shares an ordinary morning with his mother. He drops clothes on the floor, gets a little argumentative over breakfast, and generally enjoys the ordinary routine that we know will soon be disrupted. By the time little Alex leaves for school, the audience is thoroughly primed for the dreadful realization that he won't be coming home.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: By Anatole Broyard DANCING FOR MEN. By Robley Wilson Jr. 163 pages. University of Pittsburgh Press. $12.95.

title: GENERAL SHALE PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net loss...C-Including a net gain of $1,763,000 from the sale of land

title: SILVERCREST INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The yr-ago results are restated to reflect more appropriately the yr-end adjustments for worker's compensation insurance and capitalized interest

title: UNION ELECTRIC STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Jack Whittemore Memorial
description: A memorial service will be held for Jack Whittemore, an agent for jazz musicians, tomorrow at 4 P.M. in St. Peter's Church, Lexington Avenue and 54th Street. Among those who will play at the service are the Stan Getz Quartet, the saxophonists Phil Woods and Sonny Fortune, the pianists Ahmad Jamal, Hank Jones and McCoy Tyner, and the bassist Ron Carter. Mr. Whittemore died last month.

title: MEGADATA CORP reports earnings for Yr to Oct 31
SPS TECHNOLOGIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
UNITED INNS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
THE GOVERNMENTS OF WEST AFRICA OFFER LITTLE HELP
description: One of the cruelest aspects of the forced exodus of Ghanaians from Nigeria is that the governments of West Africa have done relatively little to help the poor, anxious, hungry and sick people making the 300-mile trip from Lagos to Accra, the Ghanaian capital.

title: MOZAMBIQUE SEEKS WESTERN INVESTMENT
description: The Socialist Government of this potentially rich but desperately underdeveloped country is eager for Western investment and technical services. Cabinet ministers say they would welcome joint ventures and other forms of participation in mining, manufacturing, fishing and even the ideologically sensitive area of agriculture.

title: LEFT IN THE DARK
description: To the Editor:

title: INSANITY DEFENSE: IRRATIONAL IN ANY FORM
description: To the Editor:

title: TECK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COMMUNICATIONS GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net income including extraordinary tax credits of $57,000 or 14 cents a shr for the qr and $132,000 or 33 cents a shr for the 9 mos

title: WOMAN IN KILLING SENTENCED TO CHURCH HOME
description: A New Jersey judge today ordered an 18-year-old woman to live and work at a Roman Catholic home for women for at least 30 months as an alternative to imprisoning her for setting a house fire that killed her brother.

title: AN END FOR DOLLS, A START ON COURT
description: LOS ANGELES M ore than 10 years ago, on a porch in Riverside, Calif., Cheryl Miller, the third of the five Miller children, sat and watched her two older brothers play basketball. Her life then revolved around dolls and tea parties, thanks to the persistence of her mother. ''My mom would buy the dolls, and I would cut all the hair off. That was the end of the dolls,'' she said. The tea parties were endured in a similar manner. ''After all the cookies and brownies were gone,'' Cheryl said, ''so was Cheryl.''

title: NEW HAMPSHIRE RESIDENTS UNSETTLED BY POWER LINES FROM NUCLEAR PLANT
description: Here in this graceful old farming town on the banks of the Pow Wow River, where the stagecoach from Concord, N.H., used to pass south to Boston, the ethos of Colonial America has come into conflict with the technology of 20th century New England.

title:
PATENTS;
Pedometer Measures Distance Between Legs
description: Three Californians have patented an electronic pedometer that measures the distance between a runner's legs as well as distances covered. Patent 4,371,945, issued this week, is owned by Lawrence Joseph Karr and Gary Low Wasserman, both of Marina del Rey.

title: Washington Press Blackout
description: A power failure blacked out the National Press Building today, catching Chancellor Bruno Kreisky of Austria at lunch on the 13th floor, trapping people in elevators and disrupting the work of news agency, newspaper and television bureaus.

title: New Oil Talks Held Doubtful
description: A gathering of international oil officials here next week appears unlikely to become the forum for serious negotiations among ministers of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, according to analysts and local officials..

title: KLM ROYAL DUTCH AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results are translated at the rate of 2.65 Dutch guilders equal $1

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Disorderly Conduct
description: If there was a hero in Thursday night's game between the Oilers and the Los Angeles Kings in Edmonton, it had to the referee, Ron Hoggarth. Before it was over, he had assessed 42 penalites totaling 144 minutes, broken up two brawls, ejected two players and dealt with a constant flurry of aggressive stick action.

title: PARAGUAY STRONGMAN DUSTS OFF HIS VOTING ROUTINE
description: Paraguay will hold a presidential election Sunday and there is little doubt that Gen. Alfredo Stroessner will be re-elected.

title: U.S. RULES AGAINST M.T.A. ON SUBSIDY FOR SUBWAY CARS
description: The Commerce Department ruled today that the Canadian Government had illegally subsidized the sale of 825 subway cars to the Metropolitan Transportation Authority with $91.2 million of export credit financing.

title: ROSALYNN SUMNERS TO SKATER
description: Performing at her best under the pressure of a strong challenge from the champion of the world, Rosalynn Sumners tonight won her second straight senior women's title in the United States Figure Skating championships at the Civic Arena.

title: Lichtenstein to Be Cited
description: Harvey Lichtenstein, president and executive officer of the Brooklyn Academy of Music, will receive the 1983 Capezio Award. The $5,000 prize, which honors lifetime achievement in dance, will be presented to Mr. Lichtenstein by the dancer Twyla Tharp in a ceremony at the Juilliard School on April 25.

title: PACIFIC TELECOM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The yr-ago results have been restated for acquisitions

title: HALL, FRANK B, & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Portuguese Election Called for April 25
description: President Antonio Ramalho Eanes dissolved Parliament today and announced a general election for April 25.

title: YOUNG ECONOMICS WORTHY OF SUPPORT
description: To the Editor:

title: RAILROADS' TRUCK UNITS LAG
description: The nation's railroads, which last month won greater freedom from the Interstate Commerce Commission to enter the trucking business, are having trouble with the trucking subsidiaries they already own.

title: RUBBERMAID INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
WAVERLY PRESS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings and shrs outstdng reflect a 10 percent stock divd paid in June 1981

title: Dickerson's Price Soars
description: If the United States Football League is supposed to be a low-budget version of the National Football League, somebody had better tell the Arizona Wranglers. The team has already offered Eric Dickerson, the Southern Methodist tailback, $1.5 million for three years, and it is expected to come up with an even higher bid.

title: Rogers Cable
description: United Artists Communications Inc., San Francisco, and Rogers Cablesystems Inc., Toronto, will divide their interests in Rogers UA Cablesystems Inc., Rogers announced. Rogers UA is the former UA-Columbia Cablevision Inc. and is one of the leading cable television companies in the United States; it is owned 51 percent by Rogers and 49 percent by United Artists Communications. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval.

title: SPECTRADYNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONNECTICUT TRANSPORTATION CHIEF DEFENDS STATE OF NEW HAVEN LINE
description: J. William Burns, the Connecticut Transportation Commissioner, told state legislators this week that service on the New Haven commuter rail line would improve and that the state had nothing ''to apologize for.''

title: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 5, 1983; The Economy
description: The jobless rate fell sharply in January, its first decline in the 17 months since the start of the recession. With the military included in the data for the first time, the rate dropped to 10.2 percent from 10.7 percent, the Labor Department reported. Without the military, the decline was to 10.4 percent from 10.8 percent. By adding the military, officials increased the total number of employed. President Reagan hailed the report as evidence of a trend toward lower unemployment, but economists cautioned that January data are subject to wide seasonal swings. (Page 1.) In New York City, the jobless rate rose. (7.)

title: ATLANTA GAS LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CITY REQUESTS A U.S. WAIVER TO BAN HUGE TRUCK TRAILERS
description: New York City yesterday asked for permission to ban double-trailer trucks from its highways, but Federal officials said they were uncertain whether they had the power to grant such permission.

title: U.S. Seeks to Oust Teamster
description: The Government has asked that the teamsters' president, Roy L. Williams, who is facing sentencing for a bribery conspiracy conviction, be ordered to resign immediately because of reputed links to organized crime instead of keeping his post until appeals are exhausted.

title: Double Balance in Trenton
description: Governor Kean's budget for New Jersey is in balance, at $6.8 billion, owing to a modest spending increase of 3.4 percent and a plan to raise commuter fares and tuition at state colleges. The budget is also in political balance because the Republican Governor, looking for more legislative seats next fall, has backed away from layoffs and spending cuts.

title: DAN RIVER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SPORTS CHANNEL ADDS BUSINESS NEWS
description: Cable television's 24-hour-a-day sports channel is about to become a 22-hour-a-day sports channel. On March 1, ESPN, the Entertainment and Sports Programming Network, will begin offering a two-hour business-news program in the early breakfast hours, Mondays through Fridays.

title: DATA SHIFT WAS URGED IN 1979
description: A commission appointed by President Carter to review how the Bureau of Labor Statistics compiled its figures recommended in 1979 that armed forces personnel stationed in the United States be added to the total work force.

title: POOR READERS' LOT
description: To the Editor:

title: News Summary; SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 5, 1983
description: International The United States and China agreed on preliminary steps to renew high-level military contacts between them in a meeting Secretary of State George P. Shultz had in Peking with Defense Minister Zhang Aiping. Mr. Zhang accepted an American suggestion for closer military relations, which were largely suspended when the Reagan Administration took two years ago. (Page 1, Column 1.) Washington is ''deadly serious'' about achieving weapons cuts, Vice President Bush said in Geneva. The Vice President, in meetings with Soviet negotiators, pressed Moscow to revise its position in the arms reductions talks. In a speech to the United Nations Disarmament Committee, Mr. Bush linked progress in the discussions about intermediate-range missiles with Moscow's abandonment of what he said was its monopoly on the weapons and its recognizing the ''legitimate security concerns'' of the United States. (1:1.)

title: NAUGLES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 13
description: B-Includes an extraordinary credit of $187,800

title: COPPERFIELDS MINING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: In Search of Snow at Shea

title: More Unilever Cutbacks
description: Unilever N.V. said today that it expects to cut 900 to 1,000 jobs in its Dutch plants in 1983 under continuing restructuring measures.

title: FINDING FOOD SURPRISES IN SOME UNLIKELY PLACES
description: Finding great food when it is expected is one kind of surprise and always a memorable pleasure: The three-star restaurant lives up to its reputation, the highly touted home cook is every bit as good as she's cracked up to be.

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: Under this rubric, The Times will amplify articles or rectify what the editors consider significant lapses of fairness, balance or perspective.

title: Fewer Jobless in Canada
description: Canada's unemployment rate fell to a seasonally adjusted 12.4 percent in January from 12.8 percent the previous month, the Government reported today.

title: DOMTAR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After special charges of $100,000 for the qr and $10.7 million for the yr...C-Net income including special gains of $800,000 for the qr and $4.2 million for the yr

title: THE REGION
description: New Jersey's Attorney General said today that he would not immediately reinstate Harold J. Ruvoldt Jr., the suspended Hudson County Prosecutor who was acquitted of conspiracy, extortion and bribery charges by a Federal jury Thursday.

title: SOLAR EQUIPMENT STOCK OFF SHARPLY
description: The stock of A.T. Bliss & Company, a maker of solar hot water systems, was whipsawed yesterday by a sell recommendation issued by a Detroit brokerage house. The stock opened at 30 1/2, dropped to as low as 15 bid before trading was temporarily halted, and then recovered to close at a bid price of 23 3/8.

title: Kean Will Visit Israel in March
description: Governor Kean plans to visit Israel at his own expense in March to mark the 40th anniversary of his father's plea in Congress that the United States move quickly to rescue Jews from extermination by Nazi Germany, a spokesman said today.

title: I.R.S. ASKS TOYOTA FOR TAX DATA
description: The Government disclosed today that it is investigating the possible underpayment of millions of dollars of United States income taxes by the American sales unit of Japan's Toyota Motor Corporation, the world's third-biggest manufacturer of motor vehicles.

title: Pick a Boxcar
description: Picture two long trains of empty boxcars passing in the night, each headed for the yard where the other began. It might be some triumph of Soviet planning, with the apparatchiks in Omsk fulfilling a transport plan that does nothing for their comrades in Tomsk. Actually, this shipping of air is now commonplace in America, thanks to our own version of central planning. But the Interstate Commerce Commission will soon have a chance to end the waste by giving railroads a freer hand in boxcar rentals.

title: BRUSH WELLMAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $6,740,000 for the qr and $7,487,000 for the yr...C-Net income including income of $22,000 from discontinued operations...D-Including income of $230,000 from discontinued operations

title: U.S. AND CHINA PLAN INITIAL STEPS TO REVIVE THEIR MILITARY CONTACTS
description: The United States and China agreed today on preliminary steps to revive high-level military contacts that were largely suspended after the Reagan Administration took office two years ago.

title: Baines's Bonanza
description: The Chicago White Sox and Harold Baines, their 23-year-old outfielder, have agreed to an astonishing long-term deal. The agreement, according to people who are familiar with baseball contracts, is the richest ever signed by someone with as little major league service as Baines has: three years.

title: Salvador Rebels Press Attack on 3 Fronts
description: Leftist guerrillas fighting on three fronts routed Government forces in one town and attacked another today.

title: EMPIRE FURNISHINGS: A QUESTION OF TASTE
description: There are lots of claws and paws but no ''hairy legs'' on the American Empire antiques purchased in 1981 to furnish Drumthwacket, the New Jersey Governor's Mansion in Princeton.

title: EMPLOYEES AT CENTER FOR RETARDED FOUND ASLEEP DURING WORK
description: Employees of a state center in Queens that cares for retarded people were found sleeping on the job, floor checks at the facility were infrequent and there were ''poor inventory controls over drugs,'' State Comptroller Edward V. Regan reported in an audit yesterday.

title: Ford Cutback in Britain
description: The Ford Motor Company Ltd. said today that it planned to reduce the number of its hourly workers at its Dagenham, Essex, car assembly factory by 2,900, to about 7,500.

title: REED STENHOUSE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DOW CLIMBS 13.25 IN HEAVIER TRADING
description: An impressive drop in the unemployment rate last month sent stock prices up sharply yesterday in accelerated trading. The Dow Jones industrial average ended the session ahead 13.25 points, to 1,077.91. For the week, the blue-chip barometer gained 13.16 points, spurred mostly by indications of an improving economy.

title: DANCE: HARLEM TROUPE WITH 'FALL RIVER LEGEND'
description: It was a triumph, a sheer utter triumph, Thursday night for Agnes de Mille, for the Dance Theater of Harlem, for its company premiere of ''Fall River Legend'' and for Virginia Johnson, who made something shattering and new of the heroine in Miss de Mille's wellknown study of murder in Massachusetts.

title: MANAGUA REPORTS 73 REBELS SLAIN
description: Nicaraguan troops killed 73 rightist guerrillas last weekend in two clashes near the Honduran border in Miskito Indian territory, the Government said today.

title: OPERA: MET PRESENTS 'ADRIANA LECOURVREUR
description: The Metropolitan Opera's current production of ''Adriana Lecouvreur'' seems a sturdy representation of Cilea's wispy late Romantic opera. The 18th-century Parisian interiors by C.M. Cristini and Ray Diffen's costumes suggest elegance; the staging by the noted Italian film actor Raf Vallone works well, and Donald Mahler has rechoreographed the ballet sequence in Act III for this year's production.

title: AMERICAN FAMILY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
QUEBEC TELEPHONE CO reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
FRANKLIN ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MOZART'S EARLIEST SYMPHONY, COMPOSED AT 9, IS DISCOVERED
description: Mozart's very first symphony has been discovered and authenticated by international experts, and will be performed in Denmark in March or April. Mozart was about 9 years old when he wrote it.

title: TEXAS-NEW MEXICO POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Image Problem on Park Ave.

title: State Plans Aid For Lackawanna
description: The state's Commissioner of Commerce, William J. Donohue, today announced a plan designed to lessen the impact of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation's decision to shut down basic steel making in Lackawanna.

title: UNITED BANKERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings and shrs outstdng are adjusted for a stock split; results for the latest qr reflect a significant increase in the provision for loan losses

title: Luge Team Molds 12 Nervy Pioneers
description: The announcer's voice booms over the loudspeakers to the few spectators standing along the Mount Van Hoevenberg ice track here: ''Remember, ladies and gentlemen, you are watching the sport of luge, the fastest, most exhilarating event on the planet.'' A pause. ''By the way,'' the announcer continues, ''if any of you are interested in trying out for the U.S. luge team, here's the number to call. ...''

title: LIFEMARK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including income from discontinued operations of $214,000 for the qr and $818,000 for the yr...C-Including income from discontinued operations of $71,000 forthe qr and $747,000 for the yr

title: RETAIL STRATEGIES FOR A TOUGH YEAR
description: With the books closed on the retail industry's recession-weakened fiscal year, merchants everywhere are turning urgently to new strategies - more discounting, a shift to private labels, controls on buying and restructuring - to grapple with what they expect will be a trying 1983.

title: DATATRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
description: Results for the latest qr and 6 mos reflect income of $81,670 from the settlement of a lawsuit

title: Chemical Blaze in California Forces 200 to Leave Homes
description: About two hundred were evacuated as a fire in a chemical warehouse burned today, spewing toxic fumes into the air, the authorities said.

title: CHEMICAL BANK SETTLES ACCOUNTS WITH IRANIANS
description: Chemical Bank yesterday became the first American bank to settle its accounts with Iran, in line with the agreement between the United States and Iran that led to the release two years ago of 52 Americans held hostage in Teheran. The announcement was made in Washington by John M. Walker Jr., Assistant Secretary of the Treasury.

title: School Talks Break Off In Philadelphia Strike
description: Negotiations between the Philadelphia School District and striking blue-collar workers broke off today after all but 55 of the city's schools had reopened despite a strike.

title: JOBLESS RATE DIPS FOR THE FIRST TIME IN LAST 17 MONTHS
description: The nation's unemployment rate fell last month for the first time in the 17 months since the start of the recession, the Labor Department reported today.

title: National Mine Control Is Set
description: A Scottish manufacturer of mining equipment announced that it had acquired a controlling interest in the National Mine Service Company of West Virginia.

title: Judge Tells Penobscots To Obey Gambling Law
description: A Superior Court judge ruled today that the Penobscot Indian tribe was not exempt from state laws governing the gambling game called beano.

title: BUCKEYE FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary credit of $2.4 million from the redemption of bonds

title: DANCE: THE CITY BALLET, 'DELIBES DIVERTISSMENT'
description: The New York City Ballet took a pretty little work into its repertory at Thursday night's performance in the New York State Theater. And prettiness contributed to both the charm and the weakness of Peter Martins's ''Delibes Divertissement,'' a new staging of a piece originally created for last spring's School of American Ballet workshop.

title: KEMPER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including gains of $10,529,000 for the qr and $18,565,000 for the yr on the sale of investments...C-After a loss of $8,538,000 for the qr and a gain of $3,282,000 for the yr on the sale of investments

title: Sentry Co. Guard Agrees to Return
description: A guard arrested at a hotel in San Juan, P.R., and charged with stealing $11 million from a Bronx security concern, has waived extradition and will return to New York this weekend, officials said today.

title: NO CAP ON SPENDING
description: .8,2I was thinking the other day: What if I were given next year's proposed defense budget and had to spend it in a year? What would I spend two hundred and thirty-eight billion, six hundred million dollars on?

title: FORCED FLIGHT OF GHANAIANS FROM NIGERIA SEEMS TO EASE
description: The migration of Ghanaians expelled from Nigeria along with other foreigners 18 days ago seemed to be easing today, leaving questions about the real scope of the exodus.

title: RABBI REBUTTED BY KOCH IN DISPUTE ON HOMELESS
description: Mayor Koch, in a continuation of the dispute over New York's homeless population, has taped for a radio station a sharp rebuttal to a critical commentary by a rabbi.

title: VULCAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a charge of $340,000 attributable to the recently announced plans to sell the Chemung Foundry Co in Elmira, NY...C-Net income

title: SARAH DAVIS SMITH
description: Sarah Davis Smith, a member of the board of managers of the New York Botanical Garden, died yesterday of lung cancer at her home in Greenwich, Conn. She was 70 years old.

title: SPACE
description: .8,2ELY, Minn. - I grew up poor, and now, after 32 years, I see how poverty can teach a man something about public land he wouldn't have learned under other circumstances.

title: Thrift Unit Liquidation
description: An investigation is under way into the ''unsafe and unsound practices'' of a suburban savings and loan association that was closed by the Federal Home Loan Bank Board and the state authorities Thursday night, a board spokesman said today.

title: MONDALE TELLS BLACKS WHY HE BACKS WHITE IN CHICAGO RACE
description: Former Vice President Walter F. Mondale today defended his endorsement of a white Democrat in the Chicago mayoral primary as he met with black party leaders who complained that his move imperiled a black's chances.

title: Books of the Times; Magazine Melancholia
description: MANY WINDOWS. 22 Stories From Ameri- can Review. Edited by Ted Solotaroff. 348 pages. Harper Colophon Books. Paperback $7.95.

title: An Appraisal
description: There are few things in architecture more difficult than adding to a nearly perfect building. One is adding to a nearly perfect building that is also rather eccentric. That is precisely what the firm of Hartman-Cox was asked to do recently at the Folger Shakespeare Library, a building that is both as nearly perfect and as eccentric as anything in this city, and a result is one of the capital's most impressive new works of architecture.

title: FOR TV, A SURPRISE FORCES DECISIONS
description: The three commercial television networks were caught by surprise yesterday when Nancy Reagan walked in on President Reagan's televised news conference with a birthday cake for him, two days early. All three networks complained to David R. Gergen, assistant to the President for communications, and they asked him to explain why they had not been informed about an event that was obviously well planned.

title: NORDAIR LTD reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a special gain of $200,000...C-Net income including a special gain of $523,000

title: SUPERIOR OIL PROFITS DROP 67.2%
description: The Superior Oil Company reported yesterday that earnings in the fourth quarter plunged 67.2 percent, to $24 million, or 19 cents a share, from $73.2 million or 57 cents a share, in the corresponding quarter of 1981. Revenues dropped 10.1 percent, to $504.1 million, from $560.5 million.

title: No Headline
description: EXCERPTS FROM BUSH'S SPEECH TO GENEVA DISARMAMENT PANEL

title: OLSON VAULTS 19- 3 8 FOR INDOOR MARK
description: Billy Olson of the Pacific Coast Club became the first man to pole vault 19 feet indoors, clearing 19 feet 3/8 inch last night at the Toronto Star Maple Leaf Games.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Allied Corp. said it had begun its previously announced cash tender offer to purchase up to 1.5 million common shares of Instrument Laboratories Inc. at $38 a share.

title: Your Money; Utility Payout Tax Incentives
description: WHEN a tax break was offered in the 1981 tax law to participants in public utility dividend reinvestment plans, there were some doubts as to how it would be received. But the results after slightly more than a year indicate that investors have been attracted to the idea.

title: SATURDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Rockets, at Houston. (Television - Channel 9, 8:30 P.M.) Nets vs. Detroit Pistons, at Pontiac, Mich. (Radio -WVNJ, 620; 8 P.M.) Local College Games: Fordham at Iona, 1:30 P.M. (Television - Channel 4, 1:30 P.M. Radio - WFUV-FM, 90.7, and WFAS-FM, 103.9, 1:30 P.M.); St. Peter's at Manhattan, 3 P.M.; Pennsylvania at Columbia, 7:30 P.M. (Radio - WKCR-FM, 89.9; 7:30 P.M.); Pittsburgh at Connecticut, 8 P.M. (Television - USA Cable, 8 P.M.); Seton Hall at St. John's, 8 P.M. (Television - Cablevision, 8 P.M. Radio - WNYE-FM, 91.5; 10 P.M., tape); Maine at Brooklyn, 8 P.M. Other Games: Duke at Virginia (Television - ESPN, 1 P.M.); Georgia Tech at Maryland (Television -ESPN, 3 P.M.); Minnesota at Indiana (Television -Channel 4, 3:30 P.M.); Tulane at Memphis State (Television - USA Cable, 5:30 P.M., tape); South Carolina at Notre Dame (Television - ESPN, 8 P.M.); Lamar at Louisville (Television - WTBS, 8 P.M.); Iowa at Purdue (Television - ESPN, 10 P.M., tape.)

title:
PATENTS;
Four Patents Cover Helicopter Controls
description: The United Technologies Corporation, Hartford, obtained four patents this week covering flight control features of the model S-76 commercial helicopters made by its Sikorsky aircraft division in Stratford.

title: AS THE AX FALLS
description: To the Editor:

title: PENOBSCOT SHOE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 26
29 Mirage Fighters To Go to Iraq This Year
description: France will deliver 29 Mirage F-1 fighters to Iraq in the next year, and the Iraqis have asked the French for five more planes specially equipped to carry Exocet missiles, French officials said today.

title: PANCANADIAN PETROLEUM LTD reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
ARTHUR BIRNKRANT
description: Arthur Birnkrant, a writer, motion-picture executive and lawyer who taught screenwriting at the School of Visual Arts, died Thursday in New York. He was 76 years old.

title: OFFICIALS JOIN ENVIRONMENTAL CRITICISM
description: Lawyers for the State Attorney General's office and other officials testified at a hearing here today that the Environmental Conservation Department had failed to enforce laws against dumping toxic wastes into rivers and streams.

title: STANADYNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Missing Plane Found Near Departure Point
description: Searchers today found a private airplane, which had been missing for six days, just 400 yards from the end of the runway where its ill-fated flight began. One of two men aboard was still alive.

title: ZONIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
12 Senators Urge New Japan Car Pact
description: Twelve United States Senators, including the two from Michigan, home of the Big Three auto makers, today asked Bill Brock, the United States trade representative, to seek a new accord with the Japanese that would limit even more the number of the cars they send to the United States.

title: G.M. Reports A Realignment
description: The General Motors Corporation announced it was consolidating its United States foundry operations, which will come under the direction of the auto maker's Central Foundry division in Saginaw, Mich., to improve efficiency.

title: Lone Granger
description: He's perched on a white horse, seemingly about to ride out to the range, round up the villains and save the homestead. But his uniform does not quite fit the task.

title: WARNACO INC reports earnings for Yr to Jan 1
NETS TOP BULLS BY 120-98
description: Harnessing strength amid the adversity of trade talks, the Nets banded into a unit tonight that was as tight and effective as it has been all season.

title: Garage Workers Accept New Pact
description: Employees of 500 parking garages in Manhattan and the Bronx approved a new three-year contract yesterday, forestalling a strike that had been threatened for tonight.

title: Military Seeks Space To Shelter Homeless
description: Defense Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger has asked armed services base commanders to begin an urgent search for space in buildings used by the military that can be used to provide shelter to the homeless for the rest of the winter.

title: MOORE PRODUCTS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEIGHBORS FIGHT PLAN FOR ADDING TO TOWN HOUSE
description: A plan to cap a historic Riverside Drive town house with a 40-foot addition has been blocked, at least temporarily, by a long-forgotten restrictive covenant in the deed and the discovery that the building is partly on city land.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: Harold Gibson was born in Picher, Okla., and raised in Wallace, Idaho, but he just loves New York. ''Metropolitan New York has the most pleasant climate of anywhere in the United States,'' he said the other day. Mr. Gibson has watched weather in Kansas City, Anchorage, Salt Lake City and Des Moines in his time, and so he has a fair basis for comparison.

title: Miss Volk Weds Guy Stair Sainty
description: Cynthia Holland Ash Volk, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Hohne Volk of New York and Quaker Hill, Pawling, N.Y., was married yesterday to Guy Stair Sainty, son of Mrs. Christopher Lawrence Sainty of London and the late Mr. Sainty. The Rev. James Whittemore performed the ceremony in the chapel of Trinity Episcopal Church in Manhattan.

title: OPENING STATEMENT
description: Today millions of Americans can take heart. Unemployment has finally started down. This dip in unemployment coming just after the word of higher retail sales, higher auto sales and one more sign that America's on the mend. Confidence is returning, and with reason. And while we may see some ups and downs on the way to recovery, we're on the move now, and that's our best hope for more productive, lasting jobs.

title: MURRAY OHIO MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HEIST, C H, CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
BOWL AMERICA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: B-Including a gain of $123,000 from the termination of a lease

title: SUPERIOR OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Manville Claims
description: The Manville Corporation said it had requested the United States Bankruptcy Court in New York to determine the total value of all asbestos-related claims against it so that it could prepare a reorganization plan. Manville, which filed for protection under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act in August 1982, previously estimated the total liability of some 52,000 asbestos-related suits against it could exceed $2 billion, and said that it would be unable to set aside a provision to cover such liabilities.

title: BRO-DART INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
PROGRESSIVE CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-AFter securities losses of $5,774,000 for the qr and $12,994,000 for the yr...C-Net income after securities losses of $1,026,000 for the qr and $5,345,000 for the yr

title: Debt
description: * John Deere Credit Co. filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission $100 million of floating rate notes, due in 1986, to be offered by Merrill Lynch White Weld Capital Markets Group.

title: LOGICON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-AFter losses from discontinued operations of $94,000 for the qr and $537,000 for the 9 mos

title: INTEGRITY ENTERTAINMENT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings are fully diluted

title: Monica Dodd Married To Charles H. Calhoun
description: Monica M. Dodd, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Enda A. Dodd of West Islip, L.I., was married yesterday to Charles H. Calhoun, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles P. Calhoun of Verona, N.J. The Rev. Bernard Blood performed the ceremony at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Babylon, L.I.

title: F.D.I.C. Backs Dry Dock Tie
description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation announced yesterday that it had approved the previously arranged merger of the financially troubled Dry Dock Savings Bank into the healthier Dollar Savings Bank.

title: Unraveling The Web
description: The Cuomo administration, in taking office last month, said it was declaring war on high living and loose spending practices in state agencies and expressed particular dismay over what it had found inside the Urban Development Corporation.

title: ANSWERS TO QUIZ
description: Questions appear on page 12.el7 1. John Riggins, the most valuable player in the Super Bowl, carried the ball in 38 of the 78 offensive plays by the winning Washington Redskins, a record, for 166 yards, also a record, and caught one pass.

title: INTERCONTINENTAL DIAMOND CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
NEW PROCESS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Mets Deal Orta For a Reliever
description: The Mets yesterday traded Jorge Orta to the Toronto Blue Jays for Steve Senteney, a 25-year-old righthanded relief pitcher. Orta, an outfielder, was acquired from the Los Angeles Dodgers last Dec. 28 for the pitcher Pat Zachry.

title: REAGAN ASKS $9.2 BILLION IN FOREIGN MILITARY AID FOR NEXT YEAR
description: The Reagan Administration today proposed a $9.2 billion program of foreign military assistance, about $400 million more than this year.

title: Bunting Cut Explained
description: Did the Phildelphia Eagles drop the veteran linebacker John Bunting earlier this week because he was a leader of last season's player strike? No, says Coach Marion Campbell, who insists that he decided not to renew Bunting's contract solely because he wanted to make room for a younger linebacker, Anthony Griggs.

title: ULTIMATE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Creditors Meet On GHR Energy
description: Creditors of the GHR Energy Corporation met today to plan ways of protecting more than $1 billion in claims while the company seeks reorganization under Federal bankruptcy law.

title: TENT CITY GETS A REPRIEVE AFTER FIRE
description: About 200 jobless people who had been ordered out of a makeshift tent city after a fire killed one resident won a reprieve from a judge today, but all except two had already left.

title: JURY DELIBERATIONS BEGIN ON LIBYA ARMS SCHEME
description: The case against Edwin P. Wilson, a former intelligence agent accused of selling explosives to the Libyan Government, went to the jury today after a Federal prosecutor labeled as ''hard-core hogwash'' assertions by the defense that Mr. Wilson was still acting as a de facto agent when the shipment was made in 1977.

title: Metals Concern Chief Is Sentenced in Fraud
description: A State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan yesterday sentenced the president of a mineral company that defrauded investors of $1.3 million to 13 years in prison.

title: FEW 5-YEAR-OLDS FIT INTO THE FIRST GRADE
description: To the Editor:

title: SINGER TEAMED WITH BROTHER
description: The pop singer Karen Carpenter, who with her brother Richard sold more than 30 million records as the Carpenters, died Friday of cardiac arrest at Downey Community Hospital in Downey, Calif. The 32-year-old singer was found unconscious by her mother, Agnes Carpenter, at her parents' home in Downey, a suburb of Los Angeles, and was taken to the hospital.

title: A S.R.O. HOTEL'S CARING NEIGHBORS
description: To the Editor:

title: MCMULLEN BRINGING UP BABY
description: W hen the New Jersey Devils played at home Thursday night, at least half the crowd of 15,033 cheered for the visiting New York Islanders. Five weeks earlier, in another game at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, more than half the fans clearly rooted for the New York Rangers. This could be enough to give a team a complex, but the Devils have more on their minds than measuring the roar of the crowd.

title: EVOLUTION OF THYSSEN AND KRUPP
description: Thyssen and Krupp, West Germany's No.1 and No.2 steel companies, respectively, evolved in recent years into complex industrial conglomerates with numerous divisions and subsidiaries producing everything from turnkey plants to computers.

title: N.C.A.A. TV Plan Still Unresolved
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association, which has not yet received the go-ahead from a Federal appeals court, says the press of time is forcing it to proceed with television scheduling plans for the 1983 football season.

title: BOND YIELDS RISE ON CUT IN JOBLESS
description: Bond yields rose yesterday and prices fell as traders reacted to a drop in the unemployment rate and the lack of interest in buying the $14.5 billion in Treasury issues auctioned this week.

title: PATENTS
description: A new fluorescent lamp to stimulate plant growth was patented this week for the Westinghouse Electric Corporation, Pittsburgh.

title: NORTHWESTERN PUBLIC SERVICE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Comings and Goings
description: Rickey Henderson and the Oakland A's have agreed to split the difference and avoid arbitration. The base-stealing outfielder will get $800,000 this season, with a $25,000 bonus if he wins the American League's most-valuable-player award. ... Michael Dokes, the World Boxing Association heavyweight champion, and Mike Weaver have come to terms with the promoter Don King on a rematch at a date and site to be chosen.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTON ALVIN M. MARKS and Mortimer Marks, New Yorkers who for years have provided equipment for the three-dimensional display of motion pictures, are patenting a new projector attachment. The invention is described as approximately doubling the output light, creating a larger, brighter picture for the best three-dimensional effects.

title: ROE VS. WADE'S CARTE BLANCHE ON ABORTION
description: To the Editor:

title: Toronto Dominion
description: Toronto Dominion Bank said today that it had sold its 26 percent interest in Midland and International Banks Ltd. to Standard Chartered Banks P.L.C. It gave no specific figures, but said the price received was about the same as is carried on the books and will not affect second-quarter earnings.

title: SPARTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SPECTRA-PHYSICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Broken Hill Net Falls 97.4%
description: The Broken Hill Proprietary Company reported today that in the six months ended Nov. 30 its net profit fell 97.4 percent, to $2.3 million (Australian), from $87.5 million a year earlier.

title: ANCHOR HOCKING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including unusual gains of $736,000 for the qr and $2,467,000 for the yr...C-Including an unusual gain of $765,000

title: News Analysis
description: Lebanon is turning into a quagmire not only for the Israeli Army, which has been there eight months, but also for the Israeli-American relationship.

title: The Imperfect Guest
description: I see by a magazine ad that Mr. and Mrs. John Distler of Cleveland stayed in a Helmsley hotel in New York last summer and lost a $58,000 pin without knowing it. The ad publishes a letter written to Mr. Distler by Leona M. Helmsley, president of the hotels that bear her name. Thus:

title: PRESIDENT ASSAILS TRUCKER VIOLENCE AS STRIKE GOES ON
description: President Reagan today condemned the violence accompanying the strike by independent truckers and said he would not consider the strikers' demand for repeal of new taxes on gasoline and commercial trucks.

title: CONSUMER SATURDAY
description: DUNNED by creditors by mail and phone, perhaps even on the brink of b ankruptcy or mortgage default, families awash in unpaid bills may f eel as hopeless as those who faced debtors' prison in the time of D ickens.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: PROPERTY TRUST OF AMERICA reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes gains from the sale of real estate and mortgage notes of $3,087,000 for the latest yr and $2,105,000 for the 1981 yr

title: FEDERAL JUDGE IS ACQUITTED OF BRIBE CHARGES IN MIAMI
description: A jury late today found Federal District Judge Alcee L. Hastings not guilty of obstructing justice and conspiring to solicit and accept a bribe. The verdict came after 17 hours of deliberation over three days by the Federal panel.

title: DRUMTHWACKET CONTROVERSY: TWO ASPECTS
description: At Drumthwacket, the 1833 Greek Revival mansion in New Jersey that was intended to be the governor's residence, the parquet wood floors have been polished to a sheen, the walls have been painted in light sherbet colors and the carpeting has just been vacuumed. But as of now the white Ionic-columned house is empty and it looks as if it will be that way for a while.

title: BROADVIEW FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INTER-TEL INC reports earnings for Yr to Nov 30
Ontario Trust Case
description: The Ontario Government has taken over management of nearly 11,000 Toronto apartments sold last year in a complicated deal involving Swiss and Saudi investors.

title: RB INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EMPIRE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Aminoil-Shell Exploration Link
description: R.J. Reynolds Industries' Aminoil USA Inc. subsidiary said it had acquired an interest in about 700,000 acres of the Shell Oil Company's petroleum exploration leases in the Ouachita Belt area of Oklahoma and Arkansas, and that it had begun a joint venture with Shell to develop the area's potential energy reserves.

title: A Hard Tread on the Consumer
description: If you need new tires, you can ask for the brand you last saw advertised on television - or you can compare tread life by objective test grades stamped on the tire. At least you could until this week: the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has now suspended the standard.

title: IDEOLOGICAL VISAS
description: One would normally expect Gabriel Garcia Marquez, who won the 1982 Nobel Prize in Literature, to be a welcome visitor in the United States. In fact, the Colombian novelist often has been prohibited from entering this country because of his leftist political views. When not entirely barred, he has been admitted on a limited and conditional basis. As Mr. Marquez observed in a recent published interview, ''The State Department plays this game with me in which I may or may not be able to go'' to America. What enables the State Department to ''play this game'' is a 1952 law that was enacted by Congress during the height of the cold war.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: OTHER MOVIES

title: Of Assessments; And Haircuts
description: F rederick A.O. Schwarz Jr., the city's Corporation Counsel, thinks it's unfair to ask the city to assess commercial property without being able to see the buildings' income and expense statements.

title: Brooklyn Fire Kills Woman and Son, 6
description: A 28-year-old woman and her 6-year-old son were found dead in their blazing second-floor Brooklyn apartment early yesterday morning, the police said.

title: S.E.C. BID ON NAMES IS DENIED BY SWISS
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that Switzerland had denied its request for the identities of investors involved in illegal insider trading in the stock of an American company, Santa Fe International.

title: Robert Merriman, of Stage; Actor, Producer and Director
description: Robert Merriman, an actor, producer and director on the Broadway stage, Off Broadway and on television, died Wednesday of a heart attack at Putnam Memorial Hospital in Bennington, Vt. He was 66 years old.

title: TRI-SOUTH INVESTMENT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes extraordinary gains of $1,841,000 for the qr and $2,896,000 for the yr...C-Includes extraordinary gains of $1,059,000 for the qr and $2,889,000 for the yr

title:
PATENTS;
Three Steps Utilized To Recover Hormones
description: The Genex Corporation, a genetic engineering company with headquarters in Rockville, Md., received a patent this week for a method of recovering hormones that are helpful in certain chemical and biological processes within the body.

title: GERMAN STEEL OUTLOOK: GRIM
description: West Germany's once-powerful steel industry is looking more and more vulnerable every day. Recession is dragging at traditonal markets and production is down. State-owned competitors in Italy or France are underbidding them, and the steel mills they sold to Brazil and South Korea a few years ago, to offset falling revenues from steel, are clogging their backyard with cheap imports.

title: SRI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After capital losses of $218,877 for the qr and $10,899 for the yr...C-After a capital loss of $68,274 for the qr and a capital gain of $131,279 for the yr; the rev figures include net investment income of $7,073,063 fora the latest qr and $25,794,105 for the latest yr and $6,085,384 for the yr-ago qr and $21,048,643 for the 1981 yr

title: CORDIS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including extraordinary credits of $178,000 for the qr and $478,000 for the 6mos...C-Including extraordinary credits of $373,000 for the qr and $400,000 forthe 6 mos from a change in accounting; results reflects equity in the company's 50 percent owned joint venture, the Cordis Dow Corp;

title: A REPORTER'S NOTEBOOK: BETWEEN BUDGET'S LINES
description: To the untrained eye, Governor Cuomo's 824-page executive budget makes dry reading indeed, but to those initiated in its mysteries, it can be as exciting as a detective thriller.

title: ROTHMANS OF PALL MALL CANADA LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BRIEFING
description: Of Archives and Politics

title: 'THE ENTITY,' SPOOKY DAYS
description: Things go bump in the night in ''The Entity,'' which opened yesterday at the Criterion and at neighborhood movie houses. The central figure is raped and assaulted by something that we and she and nobody can see but that manifests a frightening force. Furniture is smashed, lightning forks, cars career out of control. Bad business all around.

title: LAND OF LINCOLN SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KEN GREEN LEADS CROSBY BY 3 ON 68-134
description: Ken Green, a brash young golfer little known beyond his family and friends in Danbury, Conn., surprised this prestigious field today by taking the lead in the second round of the Bing Crosby National Pro-Am. Green, who has a sort of grudge against the Pebble Beach Golf Links, scored 68 there after Thursday's 66 at Spyglass Hill.

title: PRATT & WHITNEY TO CUT 2,300 FROM WORK FORCE
