description: B-Includes capital gains of $75,000 for the qr and $1,800,000 for the yr...C-After capital losses of $3,400,000 for the qr and $8,200,000 for the yr

title: Brazil in Threat To U.S. Banks
description: The head of Brazil's central bank yesterday threatened that banks refusing to restore their lines of credit to the hard-pressed New York branches of Brazilian banks would not be allowed to do business with Brazil in the future.

title: Bill Rates Increase; 6-Month at 8.345%
description: Average rates for new Treasury bills auctioned yesterday were slightly above those of a week ago, and were at the highest levels since Nov. 29.

title: CBS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $16,756,000 for the qr and $37,523,000 for the yr...C-After losses from discontinued operations of $27,876,000 for the qr and $37,358,000 for the yr; yr-ago results have been restated for an accounting change for sales returns in publishing and for the discontinuance in 1982 of the company's advertiser-supported Cable programming service and its retail stores unit

title: CHICAGO'S FISCAL HEALTH A CRUCIAL ISSUE IN ELECTION
description: The end of Mayor Jane M. Byrne's first turbulent year in office could well be a period she would want voters to forget: Borrowed funds had to be shifted quickly from construction projects to meet the city payroll. The school system, deeply in debt and unable to borrow, stood on the verge of collapse. And the Chicago Transit Authority, submerged in red ink, was rolling toward a shutdown.

title: Fannie Mae Euromarket
description: The Federal National Mortgage Association is seeking approval from the Treasury Department to sell debentures in the Eurobond market, David O. Maxwell, chairman, said yesterday.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Don Carter Realty Inc., a closely held New York company, said it would offer to buy 475,000 common shares of United Realty Investors Inc. for $16 each. Carter would hold about 27.9 percent of United if the offer were fully subscribed.

title: HOW TO EXTEND A SPAN OF ECONOMIC RECOVERY
description: To the Editor:

title: Business and the Law; Interest Clash Splits Up Firm
description: WHAT'S a law firm to do when its Chicago office takes on work that creates a conflict of interest for its Washington branch? Well, if the law firm is Kirkland & Ellis, the answer is that many of the Washington lawyers split off to create their own firm. The split, effective next week, arose from the breakup of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, when Elmer W. Johnson, the managing partner of Kirkland & Ellis, was asked to be special counsel to the Middle Western holding company that is taking over the operation of five of A.T.& T.'s Middle Western subsidiaries.

title: GANNETT CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Not Very Good
description: The East Coast Conference is having problems. Its basketball powers are defecting - St. Joseph's, Temple, Holy Cross and La Salle either have already left or are about to do so, leaving American University, Delaware, Drexel, Hofstra, Lafayette, Rider, Lehigh, Bucknell and Towson State.

title: SEARS ROEBUCK & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes realized gains and other income of $69,000,000 or 20 cents a shr forthe latest yr and $140,000,000 or 44 cents a shr for the 1981 yr

title: Tax Credit Aids Kaiser
description: The Kaiser Steel Corporation yesterday reported fourth-quarter net income of $9.8 million, or $1.33 a share, compared with a restated net loss of $515.2 million for 1981's final quarter.

title: LAWYERS VOTE AGAINST DISCLOSURE OF FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY BY CLIENTS
description: The American Bar Association voted today to require lawyers to keep their clients' secrets even when the clients are committing large financial frauds or other white-collar crimes.

title: WEIS MARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KNICKS CAPTURE FIFTH STRAIGHT
description: The Knicks' starting front line, which has been intact for 13 games since Bernard King was lost to injury, continues to be a major factor in the team's resurgence. Bill Cartwright, Len (Truck) Robinson and Louis Orr combined to shoot 79 percent from the field and score 53 points as the Knicks defeated the Indiana Pacers, 105-99, at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: DETROIT INNOVATION, IN BOLD STROKE, PRODUCES CAR WITH SHELL OF PLASTIC
description: PONTIAC, Mich. THERE is a section in most automobile assembly plants that is not usually shown to visitors. It is the place where burly men with rubber mallets and wooden wedges grapple with sticking doors and misaligned hoods, pounding and twisting them until they fit functionally, if not very well.

title: INCO LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes losses on discontinued operations of $4.6 million for the qr and $25.3 million for the yr, then for both periods an extraordinary charge of $245 million on disposition of businesses of Inco Electroenergy and a net loss of $219.6million on revaluation of investment in Exmibal

title: TV: 'KEEPING ON, 'A DRAMA OF LIFE IN A MILL TOWN
description: ''KEEPING ON,'' this evening's American Playhouse presentation on Channel 13 at 9, carries a batch of promising credits. The director and executive producer is Barbara Kopple, winner of an Academy Award a few years ago for her documentary, ''Harlan County, U.S.A.'' The script, dealing with everyday life in a small Southern mill town, was written by Horton Foote. And the cast includes Dick Anthony Williams, James Broderick, Rosalind Cash, Marcia Rodd, Carol Kane, Frances Conroy and Jeffrey De Munn. That's a lot of promise. Unfortunately, much of it is never realized in this production.

title: N.H.L. Puts Off Blues' Sale Talk
description: The president of the National Hockey League said today that the proposed sale of the St. Louis Blues, the No.1 issue facing the league's board of governors at its meeting here, had been removed from the agenda.

title: IN A RUHR STEEL TOWN, PLEAS FOR HELP
description: Wearing a funny hat, Helmut Wieczorek, Member of Parliament for the Social Democratic Party, told a fairy tale to 300 beer-tipsy carnival celebrators who had met at a tavern for some merrymaking spiced with politics.

title: No Headline
description: PITT POSTS ITS 2D BIG EAST UPSET IN WEEK

description: B-After a loss of $317,000 from discontinued operations and a loss of $7,375,000 on the disposal of discontinued operations...C-After a loss of $2,000 from discontinued operations and a loss of $280,000 on the disposal of discontinued operations...D-Net income including income of $56,000 from discontinued operations aloss of $1,698,000 on the disposal of discontinued operations and an extraordinary gain of $1,027,000

description: B-After an extraordinary charge of $862,000 for the qr and yr relating to an antitrust suit

title: FRUGAL SENTENCING REFORM IN THE GRANITE STATE

title: SEARS NET ROSE 37.9% IN QUARTER
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer, reported yesterday that its fourth-quarter net income rose 37.9 percent, to $459.4 million, or $1.31 a share, on the strong performance of the merchandising group of Sears and its growing array of financial subsidiaries.

title: BRIEFING
description: Schmidt on Speech Circuit

title: CANADIAN PACIFIC ENTERPRISES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BERG ENTERPRISES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BALLET: NEW DIRECTIONS FOR EGELVSKY COMPANY
description: THE Eglevsky Ballet opened its program on Saturday night at the Hofstra Playhouse in Hempstead, L.I., with talk of the future by Edward Villella, its artistic director.

title: TOM SEAVER'S 30 MINUTES
description: T om Seaver's locker at Shea Stadium was virtually empty. His uniforms and most of his equipment had been packed and put on a truck for the trip to St. Petersburg, Fla., where a week from Friday the Mets will open spring training. About all that remained in his locker yesterday were an old glove, an old pair of spikes, a redsleeved sweatshirt and a red warmup suit with the Cincinnati Reds' emblem on it.

title: STEEL UNION FACES MANY DIFFICULTIES AS IT HEADS INTO '83 NEGOTIATIONS ; News Analysis
description: As it begins its 1983 bargaining with the nation's major steel companies, the United Steelworkers of America, for decades one of the country's major unions, faces enormous problems.

title: MUSIC: A WEBERN EVENING
description: IT has been a century since Anton von Webern was born, and nearly 40 years since he was accidentally shot - killed by a nervous American Army cook just after the war, when the Viennese composer stepped outside to smoke a cigar after curfew. There have been many changes in the musical world in these years, but one thing has remained the same. While the compositions of Webern's teacher, Arnold Schoenberg, have received some fitful public attention, and while the music of Webern's fellow pupil, Alban Berg, has even attained a certain celebrity, Webern's own works have been thoroughly and consistently rejected by the mainstream musical public.

title: HARSCO CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
PANEL CONSIDERING A MOVABLE MISSILE SMALLER THAN MX
description: President Reagan's Commission on Strategic Forces is considering recommending development of a small intercontinental missile with a single warhead that could be deployed in specially armored carriers, according to sources close to the panel.

title: COAST TEACHERS WARNED ON TIES TO CORPORATIONS
description: In a move likely to intensify debate over conflicts of interests at major research centers, the University of California has issued written warnings to more than a dozen professors with substantial financial ties to corporations that also sponsor their academic research.

title: MCDONALD BENDIX DEPARTURE
description: The Bendix Corporation announced yesterday that Alonzo L. McDonald Jr., its 54-year-old president, would ''step aside'' March 1. The move came 48 hours after stockholders approved a merger that made Bendix a subsidiary of the Allied Corporation.

title: THEY'RE JUST WILD ABOUT EUBIE AT 100
description: Eubie Blake couldn't show up for either one of his 100th-birthday parties yesterday, but a few thousand musicians, dignitaries and listeners filled the Shubert Theater and St. Peter's Lutheran Church for concert tributes to the ragtime composer and pianist.

title: U.S. EASES NUCLEAR EMERGENCY RULE
description: The day after the April 1981 deadline for nuclear plants to complete preparation for emergency evacuations, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission's staff decided on less stringent enforcement for failures in those plans than for failures of plant equipment, according to an internal memorandum.

title: Garan Founder Leaving Post
description: The founder of Garan Inc., Samuel Dorsky, has retired as chairman at age 69, the company announced yesterday. Garan is a big New York apparel maker that sells much of its clothes to Sears, Roebuck & Company and the J.C. Penney Company.

title: ARRON RENTS OF ATLANTA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INTERNATIONAL THOROUGHBRED BREEDERS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a tax credit of $32,000 for the qr and 6 mos...C-Net loss includingtax credits of $75,500 for the qr and $75,000 for the 6 mos; yr-ago results reflect the acquisition of five breeding corporations during the 1983 first qr

title: VALVANO CREATING A POWERFUL IMAGE
description: He has been berated by a former assistant coach as a carpetbagger. He says he receives 10 letters a week denouncing his use of black players, as well as regular, sometimes bitter reminders of his failure to defeat his team's archrival, North Carolina. This season's squad has struggled since mid-January, when its leading scorer, Dereck Whittenburg, was lost for the season with a broken foot.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION
description: NEW YORK CITY leads the nation by a large margin in its high school students' achievements in independent science research, but the future of such research is threatened by sharp reductions in Federal funding and a troubled economy. These facts emerge from an analysis of trends in the Annual Westinghouse Science Talent Search, which announced its winners last week.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Picking a Parade Leader

title: AVEMCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CARLING O'KEEFE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PENOBSCOT SHOE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 26
GOING OUT GUIDE
description: AMERICANA

title: P.L.O.'S OFFSTAGE USE
description: Jordan and the Palestine Liberation Organization are apparently close to agreement on naming a joint delegation to negotiate with Israel. Yet Israel's likely refusal to talk with such a delegation - and Arab fears that the United States would support Israel's rejection -may prevent Jordan and the P.L.O. from offering to come to the table. President Reagan's Middle East peace initiative thus risks abrupt failure just as it seems about to produce its first tangible results. If Washington is determined to keep the initiative alive, it must accept the fact that the P.L.O. will have some role in the formation of a joint delegation.

title: Mount St. Helens Erupts
description: Mount St. Helens erupted again today, building a new mound of lava on the 700-foot-high dome in the volcano's crater and shooting an ash plume up about 15,000 feet. There were no reports of explosions or mudflows. The Army Corps of Engineers evacuated its six-member crew from a pumping station at Spirit Lake, about four miles from the volcano, and a 69,000-acre zone was closed.

title: THE DOCTOR'S WORLD
description: ACARDINAL rule of medicine is to greet startling new research findings with a healthy dose of skepticism and not to accept their validity until confirmed by other scientists.

title: PEERLESS CHAIN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Baby Sales
description: At a time of high unemployment and low productivity, America has at least one new growth industry: surrogate motherhood. Although it's illegal to sell sexual services, there are no laws governing the exploitation of reproductive potential. And since, thanks to artificial insemination, the latter is possible without the former, no owner of a surrogate parenting agency need fear being confused with a madam or a pimp.

title: DOW ADVANCES 9.19, TO ,1087.10
description: Optimism over the improving economy enabled the stock market to post a strong gain yesterday, with some of the blue-chip issues registering the biggest advances.

title: THE BASIC REALISM OF U.S. POLICY ON NAMIBIA
description: To the Editor:

title: School Star Picks Yale
description: He had offers from such college basketball powers as Virginia and Georgetown, but Ricky Ewing, a 6-foot-11-inch basketball star at Nashville University School, has set his course and made his choice.

title: COOPER UNION SETS ITS MIND ON BECOMING BETTER KNOWN
description: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art, which has been tuition-free for all its 124 years, intends to spend as much as $75,000 this year to let the world know it exists.

title: REAGAN ACCUSES ISRAELIS OF DELAY ON WITHDRAWAL
description: President Reagan, in another display of impatience with Israel, asserted today that Israel was unnecessarily delaying the withdrawal of its troops from Lebanon and neglecting its ''moral'' obligation not to become an ''occupying force'' there.

title: PENN VIRGINIA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GENRAD INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $346,000 for the qr and $596,000 for the yr...C-After losses from discontinued operations of $1.6 million for the qr and $4.7 million for the yr...D-Net loss

title: PRESIDENT CONSIDERING A PUSH FOR JOBS TO AID UNEMPLOYED
description: Washington, Feb. 7 - The Reagan Administration is considering asking Congress for supplemental funds for the 1983 budget for a quick but modest job initiative. The move is apparently aimed at separating the jobs issue from debate and maneuvering over the President's budget for the fiscal year 1984.

title: Stars Reported Getting Bryant
description: The Philadelphia Stars of the United States Football League have called a news conference for Tuesday and are expected to announce the signing of Kelvin Bryant, the North Carolina running back, and Irv Eatman, a tackle from U.C.L.A.

title: Bridge: 2 Winners in Westchester Profit From Lucky Break
description: The sectional tournament in White Plains over the weekend, officially called ''Winter in Westchester,'' proved more wintry than the organizers had anticipated or desired. But the sun was shining on the winners of the open pair championship Saturday.

title: ASARCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary gain of $15,753,000...C-After an extraordinary charge of $35,376,000...D-Net income

title: Books Of The Times
description: TWO BY FRANCIS. Forfeit and Slayride. By Dick Francis. 477 pages. Harper & Row. $14.95.

title: Machines vs. Workers
description: AS life in the new postindustrial society unfolds, economists look to history as well as statistical tea leaves to help them forecast the future. Eventually, they get around to the days when tractors reduced the number of laborers needed on farms.

title: Profits Scoreboard
F.O.M.C. SEEN STICKING TO ITS COURSE
description: The Federal Reserve Board's Open Market Committee, which convenes its most important meeting of the year Tuesday, will most likely stick to its current practice of relying more on its own judgment in setting policy and less on rigid ''targets'' for growth of the money supply, two Fed governors said today.

title: WORD PROCESSING: PROGRAM IS AN AMIABLE TUTOR
description: WORD processing - what we used to call ''writing,'' back in the old days before personal computers - is probably second only to games as the idee fixe behind the purchase of computers for the home. How this has come about I'm not sure. Certainly the concept is an easy sales peg. ''This year's computer will take care of all your word processing needs,'' says the salesman, caressing the QWERTY keys lightly with his fingertips. ''So does a pen,'' I reply.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: PATH and the Population

title: SATELLITE'S FUEL CORE FALLS 'HARMLESSLY'
description: THE last fragments of Cosmos 1402 vanished in a fiery plunge over the South Atlantic Ocean 1,100 miles east of Brazil early yesterday. Debate promptly began over whether health hazards would be created by the radioactivity it left behind in the upper atmosphere.

title: STATEN ISLANDERS AND STATE DIVIDED ON PLAN TO RELOCATE COURTHOUSES
description: A proposal to consolidate Staten Island's courts into one judicial center has caused a rift between Staten Island judges and the head of the State Office of Court Administration, Judge Herbert B. Evans.

title: THE NAZI 'BUTCHER': LYONS LOOKS BACK IN LOATHING
description: Klaus Barbie is known as the Butcher of Lyons, a title he acquired when he was head of the Gestapo here from 1942 to 1944. Those who encountered him then said he earned the sobriquet, and he is remembered with fear and anger.

title: Simplicity Pattern Picks Diversification Officer
description: The Simplicity Pattern Company, the leading maker of paper patterns for home sewing, has hired Robert E. Rosen as a vice chairman and has given him the job of figuring out how the debt-free and cash-rich company should diversify.

title: The U.N. Today; Feb. 8, 1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: Committee on Non-Use of Force - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: IDAHO POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DUQUESNE LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary gain of $9,609,000 for the qr and yr on the early extinguishment of bonds

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: BEGIN RECEIVES MASSACRE REPORT
description: The commission investigating the killings of Palestinian civilians in Beirut delivered its findings to Prime Minister Menachem Begin Monday night and is scheduled to issue its report to the public today. A part of the document dealing with Israeli intelligence matters is expected to be kept secret.

title: Prenatal Fluoridation
description: Dietary fluorides have long been known to help prevent tooth decay in children. Fluoridation of community water supplies has reduced the incidence of tooth decay by up to 65 percent for children who consume such water from birth.

title: MISREPRESENTED ENVOY
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Reports Testing Of Nonnuclear Missile
description: The Army today conducted the first test firing of a new missile without a nuclear warhead that is designed to intercept and destroy an incoming missile more than 60 miles above the ground, the Pentagon announced.

title: Times and Printers Reach Agreement
description: Typographical Union No. 6 and The New York Times reached a tentative agreement yesterday on a three-year extension of their current contract, subject to the completion of similar agreements with the nine other major unions at the newspaper.

title: GAMBLER IS ACQUITTED OF PLOTTING ASSASSINATION OF A FEDERAL JUDGE
description: A Federal jury found Jamiel Chagra not guilty today of plotting the assassination of Federal District Judge John H. Wood Jr., but convicted him on two lesser charges.

title: News Analysis
description: Despite some tough language in China's official commentary on Secretary of State George P. Shultz's four-day visit to Peking, there seems to be considerable agreement by American and Chinese officials on what Mr. Shultz did and did not accomplish there.

title: THE POLITICS OF UNFAIRNESS
description: New York State's aid to local school districts is one of those issues on which although virtually everyone agrees that the present situation is unfair, not enough state legislators have the gumption to do something fair about it. Politics, not reason, is the master here.

title: MUSIC: AMERICAN SYMPHONY
description: The American Symphony Orchestra, under the direction of Giuseppe Patane, presented a clear delineation of its collective strengths and weaknesses in Carnegie Hall Sunday afternoon.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: A Flying Visit by the Carters

title: FINK SEEKING CHANGE TO FORCE CITY TO SPLIT AID WITH SCHOOLS
description: Assembly Speaker Stanley Fink proposed today that New York City be required to share some future increases in state aid with the Board of Education.

title: Metal Markets; Token Mouth
description: Why does news that some New York City youths are sucking tokens out of the subway turnstiles generate such revulsion? Is it criminality? Perhaps, but over the years, law-abiding riders have become inured to the sight of people jumping turnstiles. Is it annoy-ance at being followed so closely by the token-sucking thief? Surely not during rush hour.

title: UNNAMED JURORS CHOSEN TO HEAR CONTEMPT CASE
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn yesterday began selecting jurors - their identities unknown to the defense, prosecution and the public - to try five advocates of Puerto Rican independence on charges of criminal contempt of court.

title: CLASSICAL MUSIC THAT'S FREE AND GOOD
description: Glenn Gould, the late Canadian pianist, made his American debut at one of the free concerts given by the Phillips Collection at Dupont Circle. The Juilliard String Quartet and the Beaux Arts Trio give free performances in the Library of Congress. In an earlier era, the library's free concerts featured the Budapest String Quartet.

title: AM CABLE TV reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INTEREST AND DIVIDENDS: KEY CHANGES IN RULES
description: The tax law takes a very broad view of what constitutes income. With the exception of gifts, life insurance proceeds, inheritances and certain prizes, just about anything that increases an individual's net worth must be reported to the Internal Revenue Service as income. That includes not only wages but also tips, gambling gains, alimony (but not child support), bartered goods, unemployment benefits and even illegal kickbacks. Interest and dividend income must be reported, too.

title: Atari and Coleco
description: Atari Inc. said it was seeking an injunction against Coleco Industries to stop it from selling an adapter that allows the Colecovision home video game unit to play Atari cartridges.

title: F.T.C. Won't Object To I.B.M.-Intel Deal
description: The Federal Trade Commission has told the International Business Machines Corporation that it will not attempt to block I.B.M.'s plan to purchase 12 percent of the Intel Corporation, the two companies said today.

title: C.I.A. INEPT ON POPE PLOT, D'AMATO SAYS
description: Senator Alfonse D'Amato said today that the Central Intelligence Agency had failed to pursue an investigation into the shooting of Pope John Paul II.

title: LONE STAR OFF
description: The Halliburton Company reported yesterday that the sharp drop in domestic oil drilling caused fourth-quarter net income to plunge 46.8 percent and revenues to decline 32.6 percent.

title: MARK PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Wounds of War
description: Staff Sgt. J. Thomas Stanley's leg wound adds a first to the United States involvement in El Salvador's civil war. He is the first American soldier to be wounded in Salvador since military advisers were sent there in 1981.

title: P.&G. Replacement For Rely Line Set
description: The Procter & Gamble Company, which pulled its Rely tampon off the market in 1980 after it was linked to a number of deaths from toxic shock syndrome, said it would introduce a new line of sanitary napkins called Always.

title: A Chance for LeFlore
description: Tony LaRussa, the manager of the Chicago White Sox, has had his differences with Ron LeFlore, but now the outfielder is going to get a chance to earn his way back into LaRussa's favor and onto the team. After polling his coaches, LaRussa has invited LeFlore to join the White Sox at spring training, but with no guarantees.

title: Court Rejects Case Of Fan Hit by Ball
description: A girl legally blinded in one eye by a foul ball at a 1979 Mets game at Shea Stadium cannot recover money from either the baseball team or New York City, which owns the stadium, a state appeals court has ruled.

title: Meredith Joins Burda in Venture
description: The Meredith Corporation announced the formation of a limited partnership with Burda G.m.b.H., a West German printing concern, under which Meredith's Park Avenue Printing Plant subsidiary will become part of Meredith/Burda.

title: ALBA-WALDENSIAN INC reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: B-After a loss of $1,414,449 from discontinued operations...C-Af ter a loss of $273,171 from discontinued operations; yr-ago sales have been restated to reflectdiscontinued operations

title: Q&A
description: Q. If meteorites enter our atmosphere at such terrific speed that they glow at white heat, how could the meteorite that reportedly fell on a house in Wethersfield, Conn., in November fail to smash through the whole house and then set it on fire? Should we suspect a hoax?

title: CBS NET DECLINES 11.9%
description: CBS Inc., citing losses from discontinued operations, reported yesterday that net income for the fourth quarter of 1982 fell 11.9 percent, to $35.7 million, or $1.27 a share, from $40.5 million, or $1.45 a share, a year earlier.

title: Dr. Albert J. Irving, 88, Dead; A Dentist and Horticulturist
description: Dr. Albert J. Irving, a dentist and former vice president of the board of directors of the Horticultural Society of New York, died Saturday at the Putnam Hospital Center in Carmel, N.Y. He lived in Brewster, N.Y., and was 88 years old.

title: No Headline
description: JOHN DWYER

title: Officials Withhold Data On Missouri Dioxin Tests
description: The results of a second round of dioxin testing in Times Beach, Mo., will not be made public until they can be verified and a Presidential committee decides what action should be taken, officials say.

title: GAF CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After extraordinary credit of 435,552,000...C-After income from discontinued operations of $33,605,000 for the qr and $54,296,000 for the yr...D-After incomeof $5,303,000 from discontinued operations and an extraordinary credit of $38,744,000; the 1981 periods also included a $15.1 million provision for Felt mill shutdowns in the building materials sector

title: TROTTIER A WING FOR ALL-STARS
description: Coach Al Arbour said today he had so much talent at his disposal for the National Hockey League All-Star Game here Tuesday night he would use Bryan Trottier, the classy center of the Islanders, as a left wing.

title: Auto Makers' Plans
description: Major United States auto makers plan to build 1,670,000 cars in the second quarter of this year, up 6.8 percent from a year earlier, Ward's Automotive Reports said today.

title: Lackawanna Down to B
description: Moody's Investors Service lowered the rating on Lackawanna, N.Y., bonds to a speculative B rating from Baa-1. In December the Bethlehem Steel Corporation said that it would close its steelmaking operations there by the end of the year. Its taxes provided half the city's operating budget.

title: Britain Steel Chief And Talk of Coal Job
description: Ian MacGregor, the blunt-spoken 70-year-old chairman of the stateowned British Steel Corporation, has reportedly been asked to take over as head of the even more deficit-prone National Coal Board when his three-year appointment at the steel company ends this summer.

title: TEXAS-NEW MEXICO POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ROBERTSON, H H, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SUITS: LONG AND SHORT OF IT
description: Two kinds of suits are in the Paris couture for spring and summer: one with a long jacket and the other with a short one. Both are meticulously tailored and have broad, padded shoulders. Narrow kneelength skirts or trousers appear with both.

title: REAGAN DISMISSES HIGH E.P.A. OFFICIAL
description: President Reagan today dismissed a top official of the Environnmental Protection Agency after she refused to resign at the request of Anne M. Gorsuch, the agency's administrator.

title: Foster Grant Sunglasses In Morning TV Spots
description: Foster Grant sunglasses will be promoted in a 100-day television advertising campaign running only on NBC's ''Today Show'' and ABC's ''Good Morning America'' and featuring personalities from those two network shows. The promotion will run on one or the other of the programs five days a week beginning Feb. 28.

title: SALVADOR'S MIDDLE CLASS: A WARY WISH FOR CHANGE
description: Tucked into the gentle slope of a hill that rises to some of the city's more exclusive homes is the neighborhood of Miramonte where some of the solidly middle class in this city of half a million live.

title: CENTRAL LOUISIANA ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for the latest qr and yr include a gain of $3.1 million on the sale of assets

title: COMPUTER TASK GROUP INC reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: Yr-ago results include a gain equal to 18 cents a shr from a tax leasing transaction

title: HOW TO EXTEND A SPAN OF ECONOMIC RECOVERY
description: To the Editor:

title: KERR-MCGEE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
One Way to Stop Runaway Costs
description: Two things are certain about souvenir programs at sports events:

title: FREDERICK S. FISCHER
description: Frederick S. Fischer, a financial-management consultant, died Saturday of heart disease at his home in Bricktown, N.J. He was 65 years old.

title: PIANO RECITAL: YOURI EGOROV
description: THE first half of Youri Egorov's piano recital at Carnegie Hall Sunday night showed the Russian school of Romantic piano playing at its strongest and its weakest. Bach's Italian Concerto, for example, sang beautifully in the central Andante, but its outer movements almost disappeared under a cloud of flying fingers and booming sonorities.

title: SAFETY-KLEEN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split on Dec 6, 1982

title: No Headline
description: AROUND THE WORLD; U.S. Helping Aliens Forced Out of Nigeria

title: Chess: Spassky Loses to Karpov In Play for TV World Cup
description: The TV World Cup in Hamburg was yet another triumph for the world champion Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union, who defeated a countryman amd former world champion, Boris Spassky, in a final playoff.

title: HALLIBURTON CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, an article yesterday on private searches for missing servicemen in Indochina incorrectly described relations between the United States and Laos. They maintain diplomatic relations.

title: Symposium on Wagner Planned at New School
description: The New School for Social Research will sponsor a daylong symposium on Richard Wagner on Saturday, the day before the 100th anniversary of the composer's death.

title: NORTH ATLANTIC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings do not reflect a 3-for-2 stock split to be paid Mar 11

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Hawks, at Atlanta, 7:35 P.M. Sugar Ray Richardson plays his first game for the Nets. The Hawks beat the Celtics Sunday at Boston.

title: New Yorker Is Named To Jersey Health Post
description: Governor Kean today announced the nomination of Dr. J. Richard Goldstein of Scarsdale, N.Y., to be the New Jersey Commissioner of Health.

title: TEXAS INSTRUMENTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for 1982 are after pretax charges of $11,600,000 relating to previouslyannounced reductions in employment levels during the yr; the yr-ago results areafter pretax costs of $36,600,000 from product phaseouts and employment reductions

title: CONQUEST EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary credit of $340,000 for the qr and yr...C-There areno comparable yr-ago results available because the company went public in Jan 1982

title: ULTIMATE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
WAS A SPORTSMAN AND WRITER
description: S. Kip Farrington Jr., a one-time stockbroker who gave up a career on Wall Street to become one of the world's leading sports fisherman and also wrote widely on fishing and other subjects, died yesterday at Southampton (L.I.) Hospital.

title: VOUCHERS, EMERGIN AS A THEME, PROVOKE DEBATE
description: President Reagan's new budget introduces the concept of Government vouchers for the elderly, the poor and the unemployed as a way of trying to use the economic forces of the marketplace to control Federal costs.

title: Nuggets Get Schayes
description: The Denver Nuggets, hoping to improve their playoff chances, have acquired Danny Schayes, a highly rated young center, from the Utah Jazz in exchange for another center, Rich Kelley, and undisclosed ''other considerations'', presumably money. The 23-year-old Schayes, in his second year as a pro, has been averaging 12.4 points and nine rebounds a game.

title: Soviet, Citing Attack On Pope, Assails U.S.
description: The official Soviet press agency Tass accused the White House today of trying to wreck United States-Soviet arms talks by ''stirring up'' allegations that Bulgaria was involved in the shooting of Pope John Paul II.

title: ALLEN ORGAN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Yr-ago shr earnings have been adjusted for a 3 percent stock divd paid Mar 5

title: KAISER STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After an income tax credit of $47 million...C-Net loss after pretax provisionof $540 million for closing of steelmaking facilities...D-After gain of $21,055,000 from sale of interests in Kaiser center and tax credit of $48 million; the company changed its method of accounting for long-term construction contracts inthe fourth qr of 1982 in response to F.A.S.B. Statement No 56

title: ABC SAYS 80 MILLION VIEWED START OF 'WINDS'
description: The premiere segment of ''The Winds of War,'' ABC-TV's massive 18-hour serialization of Herman Wouk's World War II novel, shown Sunday night, was seen by 80 million viewers, the network said.

title: JACLYN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Yr-ago shr earnings have been restated to reflect a 4 percent stock divd paid in June 1982

title: Comings and Goings
description: Bjorn Borg was spending a second night in a hospital in Providence, R.I., after being admitted Sunday night for treatment of infected hands. The infection, associates said, may have come from irritations caused by tape he wears around his hands.

title: Computer Check Finds Dead Receiving Benefits
description: A computer search of death records from 11 states, New York City and the Veterans Administration found that the Social Security system is sending checks to thousands of dead people, and that the amount of erroneous payments could reach $100 million.

title: Quotations of the Day
description: ''It is a fallacy to make a lawyer a watchman or policeman over his client.'' - John C. Elam, sponsor of amended ethics code for lawyers. *

title: WELL-EARNED REST FOR ROOKIE GOALIE
description: B ob Froese had a surprise for his wife, Ruth, when he returned to their home at Portland, Me., last weekend. It was a little more than a month ago when he was called away by the Philadelphia Flyers for the chance to be a goaltender in the National Hockey League. By the time Froese returned home, he had become the most successful undefeated goaltender to spend the all-star break at home. He might not have this time off in future seasons.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: FOR several long moments last week, the clock stood still and then m oved backward. There, making her national debut on David Letterman'st elevision show, was Cornelia Guest, the debutante daughter of C.Z. G uest, wearing a beaded dress, smoking a cigarette, singing off-key a nd telling the world that Brenda Frazier was her precursor.

title: PETROLANE INC reports earnings for QTr to Dec 31
description: B-After a loss of $140,000 for the latest qr from discontinued operations and again of $5,616,000 for the yr ago qr from discontinued operations

title: AIRBORNE FREIGHT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including a gain of $732,000 for the qr and yr from the sale of the stock in two units and a gain of $55,000 for the yr from discontinued operations...C-Net losses after a loss of $52,000 for the qr and a gain of $91,000 for the yr from discontinued operations

title: RAND, GOLD SHARES DIP
description: A weekend decree by the South African Government that abolished exchange controls for nonresidents, and, in effect, the two-tier currency market, depressed gold shares on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange by 10 percent today. The rand, meanwhile, dropped to 88 cents in United States currency, from 93 cents at the weekend.

title: Fight Card Reported
description: Bob Arum, the boxing promoter, was flying across the Atlantic and wasn't able to confirm the report, and one of his top aides suggested it might be no more than talk. But what the owner of the Sun City resort in Bophuthatswana was talking about yesterday was a twin-bill fight card featuring title defenses by Ray (Boom Boom) Mancini and Davey Moore and a solo concert by Frank Sinatra.

title: CORDURA CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
GULF OIL BOWS OUT OF EUROPE
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation, which has expanded throughout Europe, the Middle East and North America for more than three decades, is engaged in a sweeping restructuring aimed at concentrating its businesses in North America.

title: Rise in I.M.F. Drawing Rights Seen
description: Momentum is growing for a modest increase in special drawing rights, an international money that countries can use to pay bills, and full agreement to go ahead with the increase may be reached later this year, monetary officials said today.

title: KEAN POSTPONES TV LOTTERY TEST PENDING INQUIRY
description: Governor Kean today postponed indefinitely a televised state lottery game until the completion of an investigation into the possible involvement of lottery officials and other public figures with the companies bidding for the games contract.

title: Nuclear Bark, Budget Bite
description: The Administration's new defense program at last demonstrates verbal sensitivity to American and European concern about nuclear war. Secretary Weinberger's report to Congress, accompanying the 1984 budget, avoids the belligerent tone that fired the anti-nuclear movements. There's a return to traditional emphasis on deterrence as the main function of nuclear weapons. Absent now is any Reaganite talk of seeking nuclear superiority or of arming to ''prevail'' in a nuclear war.

title: PARKWAY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SHULTZ VISITS THE DMZ IN KOREA AND SEES CHUN
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz flew by helicopter today to inspect South Korean and American military positions along the demilitarized zone with North Korea and to meet with some American soldiers stationed there.

title: INTERRUPTING MRS. THATCHER
description: SOME people manage to express their thoughts fully. Others are interrupted all the time. Margaret Thatcher, the British Prime Minister, is one of the latter, a fact that has perplexed a team of British psychologists whose work may ultimately be useful to others who find themselves interrupted.

title: CANADA CEMENT LAFARGE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net income...C-After a special charge of $2.8 million...D-Net income including a special gain of $1.3 million

title: Switch for the Talbots
description: Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, one of the prides of the Boston advertising community, has won a piece of direct marketing business that was formerly with Ogilvy & Mather Direct in New York. It is for the Talbots, a General Mills division that runs a retail chain in 10 states and has a catalogue that is distributed nationally. H.H.C.C. got the retail account a year ago. The new assignment has a $2 million budget.

title: NEW YORK TO GET A 2D AREA CODE IN MIDDLE OF '84
description: New York City, whose telephone area code has been 212 since the codes were introduced in 1947, will be divided into two area codes in mid-1984, the New York Telephone Company announced yesterday.

title: Advertising; British Air Promoting Its Image
description: SAATCHI & SAATCHI COMPTON, the new worldwide agency for British Airways, is preparing an image advertising campaign with at least one purpose unique to that Government-owned carrier's advertising.

title: No Headline
description: Changes Ahead At G.M. Divisions

title: Not a Big Deal
description: Linda Page became famous at Dobbins Tech when she scored 100 points in a girls basketball game, breaking the Philadelphia interscholastic record of 90 by an Overbrook male center named Wilt Chamberlain. Now Miss Page is No.1 again.

title: RAYMOND CORP reports earnings for QTr to Dec 31
COLUMBUS MILLS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LEADER OF PANEL ON JUDGES SEES AN 'IMBALANCE'
description: The chairman of Mayor Koch's judicial selection panel apologized yesterday for ''a certain imbalance here in terms of minorities and women'' at a swearing-in ceremony for six white male judges.

title: EX-CHIEF OF GESTAPO IN LYONS IS LINKED TO U.S. INTELLIGENCE
description: With the return of Klaus Barbie to France to face charges for murders there in wartime, new questions have been raised about the movements of the onetime Gestapo chief of Lyons since the end of the war and about his possible links with American intelligence agencies.

title: News Summary; TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 8, 1983
description: International Iran launched a new offensive against Iraq in Misan Province and claimed to have occupied 100 square miles of Iraqi territory and destroyed the combat capability of the Iraqi army. Iraq confirmed that the Iranians had tried to invade but said its forces had crushed the two Iranian divisions involved. Western intelligence sources said they could not confirm either side's claims. (Page A1, Column 4.) American impatience with Israel was displayed again by President Reagan. He asserted that Israel was delaying the withdrawal of its troops from Lebanon and was neglecting its ''moral'' obligation not to become an ''occupying force.'' (A1:5.)

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: COOPER TIRE & RUBBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BLISS, A T, & CO reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
Prices of Cattle Futures Begin to Decline Again
description: After support from bad weather and a truckers' strike, live cattle futures prices resumed their decline yesterday, much to the relief of many spreaders who had been selling the nearby contracts and buying the summer deliveries since Jan. 28.

title: THE PLEASURE OF GIVING BLOOD
description: FREQUENT blood donors may resemble sky divers more than Good Samaritans, according to the findings of a new study. Curious as to why so many people become habitual blood donors, University of Wisconsin psychologists administered before-and-after questionnaires to 1,846 donors at a campus blood collection center.

title: FRANCE'S CASE AGAINST A SOVIET ARMS PLAN
description: To the Editor:

title: Market Place; Of Amdahl And Heizer
description: THE two biggest price gainers on the American Stock Exchange's active list last week were the Amdahl Corporation, rising 5 3/4 points, to 39 3/8, and the Heizer Corporation, advancing 1 7/8 points, to 15 7/8.

title: Addendum
description: * Hill & Knowlton Inc. has established a Northeast Region, based in Boston.

title: Slow and Easy
description: It sounds impressive: The Juggernaut. But the name does not quite fit the nation's longest ski trail, a 10-mile slice of the Northeast Passage of the Killington, Vt., ski area.

title: LINCOLN CENTER PICKS NEW PRESIDENT
description: The new president of Lincoln Center has one musical ability none of his predecessors, including the composer William Schuman, ever had. Glenn W. Ferguson, whose appointment was announced yesterday, plays the bongo drums. He learned that exotic instrument in 1966 during his tenure as Ambassador to Kenya.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Resources Management Corp., Denver, has named J.B. Kimo Smith vice president and general counsel.

title: IRANIANS LAUNCH INVASION OF IRAQ IN THE SOUTHEAST
description: Thousands of Iranian troops began a new attempt to invade Iraq early yesterday in what Iran's state radio called the biggest offensive since the war broke out in September 1980.

title: SCURRY-RAINBOW OIL LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GENERAL MOTORS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Riding the Urban Range

title: U.S. SURVEY CITES RIGHTS VIOLATIONS AROUND THE WORLD
description: The Reagan Administration, seeking what it terms ''an active, positive human rights policy,'' issued its annual human rights report today. The document cited serious human rights violations in nations around the world, including some that are friendly to the United States.

title: Update Needed
description: ''I eagerly look forward to beginning the new season. ... My mental outlook is now much, much better than when I stopped. ... I will play at least 12 Grand Prix events, maybe more ... so I have a fairly intense year.''

title: Northeastern In Beanpot Final
description: A fluke goal by Greg Neary at 13 minutes 13 seconds of the final period completed a Northeastern comeback that gave the Huskies a 4-3 victory over Boston University tonight in the opening round of the 31st Beanpot Hockey Tournment.

title: WHAT A CAREER MEANS
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: I found your article , ''Mothers Who Shift Back From Jobs To Homemaking'' somewhat offensive. Women should not feel pressured to make a definitive choice between pursuing a career or a life of homemaking.

title: OPERA: 'BOCCANEGRA' IN PHILADELPHIA
description: THE feud that separated Romeo and Juliet had its origins in the political struggles that form the background of Verdi's ''Simon Boccanegra.'' The corsair of the title is made Doge of Genoa in 1339 in order to reconcile opposing factions and create a unified republic. His task is made more difficult because, as with Romeo and Juliet, his love for a woman crosses social boundaries.

title: DEADLOCKED EAST-WEST PARLEY REOPENS IN MADRID
description: After a seven-week break, the East-West conference to review the 1975 Helsinki accords on European security and cooperation resumed here today with no sign of any change in positions that have produced a longstanding deadlock.

title: Bell & Beckwith
description: A criminal investigation began today into $36 million in dummy assets that led to the collapse of Bell & Beckwith Inc., a Toledo stock brokerage firm. The 85-year-old brokerage house was closed Monday by Federal investigators after the Securities and Exchange Commission and the New York Stock Exchange learned that it had secured debts with assets that were vastly overvalued or did not exist. Edward P. Wolfram Jr., the managing director of Bell & Beckwith has resigned.

title: 'Winds' Ratings Decline For the Second Episode
description: Ratings for ''The Winds of War,'' ABC Television's 18-hour World War II epic, declined for the second episode of the seven-part series, aired on Monday night. In New York, the program achieved a 42.5 rating, compared with Sunday night's 45.5.

title: 3 DAYS OF TERROR, PANIC AND DEATH
description: Thursday, Sept. 16 On Thursday morning the Israeli Army had sealed off the entire area around the Sabra and Shatila refugee camps. An Israeli spokesman reported that the army ''is in control of all key points in Beirut.''

title: No Headline
description: BULLETS TURNBACK CELTICS IN OVERTIME

title: FRUITS OF THE TROPICS: GUIDE TO NEW TASTES
description: DEEP golden yellow stars tinged with brown, rough green-skinned hearts pockmarked with hexagons and musty yellow ovoid shapes striped with purple. Among the monotonous array of their more common seasonal relatives - apples, bananas and oranges -these fruits may still seem strangely out of place, like bits of tropical exotica that conjure up visions of hot, sunny days and lush vegetation at a time when winter is at its most unpleasant.

title: UAL and USAir to Sell Total of 5 Million Shares
description: Higher stock prices and prospects for improved business conditions have encouraged several airline companies to announce sales of common stock or other securities convertible into common stock.

title: MAPCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The decline in earnings for the latest periods was attributed to a $9 million profit decline from pipeline operations, a $12 million charge from earlier than anticipated depletion of oil and gas reserves, an after-tax loss of $7.9 million from Mapco's interest in an unconsolidated affiliate, Seminole Pipeline, and an increase in Mapco's effective tax rate in 1982 from 27.8 percent in 1981

title: BRIEFING
description: Reception for Kim

title: U.S. Reviewing Gerulaitis Case
description: The Justice Department approved yesterday actions taken by the United States Attorney in Manhattan in a cocaine investigation involving Vitas Gerulaitis.

title: TIDEWATER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Q&A
description: Q. Once in a while recipes call for eggs to be added to one raw dish or another; others call for the eggs to be beaten before adding. Does it really matter if the eggs are beaten before adding, for example, to meat loaf?

title: Wickes Offering Plans to Creditors
description: The Wickes Companies, the huge retailer that filed last April for court protection under the Federal bankruptcy laws, yesterday took the first step toward reorganization by proposing a framework to settle its $1.6 billion of debt.

title: A 'SYSTEMS PERSON' AS TAX CHIEF: RODERICK CHU
description: Even before Governor Cuomo publicly announced the appointment of Roderick Chu as the state's new Commissioner of Taxation and Finance, Mr. Chu was deep in meetings with administration budget aides and tax agency officials in a quest for a few hundred million dollars.

title: GTE GAINS 24.9%
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company reported yesterday that net income in the fourth quarter fell 38.4 percent, citing the recession and certain extraordinary charges. Sales dipped 1.6 percent.

title: AMF INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After losses of $13,443,000 for the qr and $19,805,000 for the yr from discontinued operations...C-Net income after a loss of $2,695,000 from discontinued operations...D-After a loss of $41,048,000 from discontinued operations and a tax credit of $12,034,000

title: Bill to Aid Hospital With Borrowing
description: Governor Kean today signed a bill to enable the Jersey City Medical Center to borrow money so it can remain open.

title: Japan Signs Sea Law Treaty
description: Japan became the 119th country to sign the Law of the Sea Convention in Jamaica, Foreign Ministry officials said today. Japan was one of 24 countries, including the United States and its West European allies, that did not sign the convention at the final meeting of the Law of the Sea Conference at Montego Bay, Jamaica, last December.

title: HOW PANEL MARSHALED MOUNTAIN OF FACTS
description: The three-member Israeli commission of inquiry that reported today on events surrounding the massacre of Palestinian civilians in West Beirut last September was appointed by the Cabinet on Oct. 1.

title: Man With 105 Wives Is Convicted of Fraud
description: Giovanni Vigliotto, who said he married more than 105 women in 33 years, was found guilty today of fraud and bigamy in marrying an Arizona woman in in 1981.

title: ...AND ON RELIGIOUS FREEDOM IN THE U.S.
description: To the Editor:

title: GTE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
'I MAKE HATS BECAUSE IT FEELS GOOD'
description: MARY BRIGHT makes hats. She does it with a passion, she says, and with drive, dedication and decision. ''I make hats because it feels good,'' she commented in her studio at 219 Mott Street. ''It feels good to work with my hands, to solve problems, to start with nothing and make hats that I want. You have to want what you do. That's why I started. I couldn't find a hat I was willing to wear.''

title: A 'SNOWBIRD' TALKS HOCKEY
description: UNIONDALE, L.I. A nne Murray can remember the Saturday nights by the television set, her five brothers and her father debating the merits of her country's two major league hockey teams, the Maple Leafs and the Canadiens.

title: SPECULATION ON T.W.A. SPINOFF
description: Making money flying airplanes is not as easy as it once was, and an established but unprofitable American carrier, Trans World Airlines, may eventually be spun off by its corporate parent.

title: PRIESTS DEFY POPE ON SANDINIST POSTS
description: Pope John Paul II will visit Managua next month even though five Roman Catholic priests have rejected the Vatican's original condition that they first resign their positions in Nicaragua's leftist Government, Roman Catholic Church officials said today.

title: CONTINENTAL GROUP OF CANADA LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Knicks Close Their Trap on Pacers
description: The Knicks were struggling Monday night at Madison Square Garden against the Indiana Pacers, a team they had not beaten this season. The Pacers had just taken the lead, 68-67, on Billy Knight's 10-foot jump shot with 4 minutes 24 seconds left in the third quarter. Moments later, when the Pacers regained possession, it happened.

title: THE NAZI GLUT
description: I am watching ''The Winds of War.'' Everybody said this was what all America would be doing this week. Watching ''The Winds of War.'' I want to feel one with all America. So I am watching ''The Winds of War,'' and my mind is wandering. One virtue of ''The Winds of War'' is that it doesn't make heavy demands on your attention.

title: Belva Kibler, Mezzo-Soprano; Sang Concerts and in Opera
description: Belva Kibler, retired concert and opera singer, died after a long illness on Thursday in Santa Monica, Calif.

title: Petry Wins a Raise
description: Dan Petry, the Detroit pitcher, won his salary arbitration yesterday when he was granted the $390,000 he had asked.

title: NASSAU WORKERS WARNED OF LAYOFFS
description: The Nassau County Executive, Francis T. Purcell, said today that furloughs or layoffs of county employees would be necessary to close a huge budget gap if the State Legislature refused to pass an increase in the county's sales tax.

title: PROGRESSIVE CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After securities losses of $5,774,000 for the qr and $12,994,000 for the yr...C-Net income after securities losses of $1,026,000 for the qr and $5,345,000 for the yr

title: WEDNESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Indiana Pacers, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, East Rutherford, N.J., 7:35 P.M. Michael Ray Richardson, the former Knick and newest Net, returns to the metropolitan area.

title: INTERNATIONAL CONTROLS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After a charge of $610,000 from the establishment of reserves for future plant relocation and a contract liability...C-After a $633,000 writedown of certain assets to estimated realized value...D-Including an extraordinary credit of $3.4million and income of $1.2 million from the reversal of tax reserves no longer required

title: BARNES GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COMPUDYNE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Reflects equity in loss of unconsolidated affiliate of $67,000

title: THEATER: BOSTONIAN LIFE IN 'PAINTING CHURCHES'
description: woman show at a 57th Street gallery. Her specialty is painting portraits in an impressionistic style that's been acclaimed as ''a weird blend'' of Bonnard, Cassatt and Hockney. In Tina Howe's ''Painting Churches,'' Mags returns to her childhood Beacon Hill home to do just what the play's title promises - to paint a portrait of her elderly Brahmin parents, Gardner and Fanny Church.

title: YALE INVESTS $1.5 MILLION FOR NEW HAVEN REVIVAL
description: Yale University today announced the investment of $1.5 million in a large downtown redevelopment project here. Both Mayor Biagio DiLieto and Yale's president, A. Bartlett Giamatti, said the investment was a watershed in ''town and gown'' relations.

title: Judge in Los Angeles Ousted for Misconduct
description: A Los Angeles judge has been removed from office for ''persistent and pervasive'' misconduct, including making racist remarks and holding a bargain day on which sentences for misdemeanor offenders were halved.

title: What a Career Means TO THE LIVING SECTION:
description: While I sympathize with women who are troubled by the strains of continuing a career at the same time that they are raising young children, in the latest article on this topic (''Mothers Who Shift Back From Jobs to Homemaking,'' Jan. 19) a number of important issues are not satisfactorily considered.

title: The U.N. Today; Feb. 9, 1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: Committee on Non-Use of Force - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: OFFSHORE LOGISTICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Coghlan Inspired Amid His Grief
description: The thought came to Eamonn Coghlan while he was putting some wood on the fire at his home in Rye, N.Y., yesterday: His father, Bill Coghlan, had stacked the wood inside the house shortly before he died there of a heart attack last week.

title: WON PULITZER PRIZE IN 1957
description: Buford Boone, who won a Pulitzer Prize for ''courage and independence'' in a 1957 editorial deploring unrest over the admission of the first black to the University of Alabama, died of cancer Monday at the age of 74.

title: Italy Arrests 2 Priests
description: The police have arrested two priests in connection with an oil scandal that cost ztaly millions of tax dollars. Msgr. Simeone Duca and the Rev. Francesco Quaglia were arrested Monday on charges of accepting several thousand dollars from owners of small petroleum companies for influencing the transfer of a tax official, the police said. The fuel scandal involved illegally switching tax documents on home heating and diesel oil during the 1970's.

title: DRIVER IS KILLED AS TRUCK SKIDS OFF TAPPAN ZEE BRIDGE
description: A truck driver was killed today when his tractor trailer struck a median barrier on the Tappan Zee Bridge, veered across three lanes and smashed through a guard rail, plunging 80 feet into the Hudson River.

title: F.A.A. TO EASE AIR RULE IMPOSED IN '81 STRIKE
description: The head of the Federal Aviation Administration has sought to reassure the airlines that the agency has no intention of permanently retaining restrictions on air traffic that were imposed as a result of the strike by air traffic controllers.

title: Gulf's Stations Cut in 2 States
description: The Gulf Refining and Marketing Company, a division of the Gulf Oil Corporation, said it would discontinue its branded marketing operations in Michigan and in 18 northwest Ohio counties.

title: 2 Officers Are Promoted In M-G-M/U.A. Changes
description: The M-G-M/U.A. Entertainment Company announced yesterday that Donald Sipes had been promoted to chairman and chief executive of its United Artists Corporation unit.

title: BLACK HILLS POWER & LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GOODYEAR TO ACQUIRE CELERON
description: In its first major diversification move in nearly two decades, the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company announced yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the Celeron Corporation, a fast-growing natural gas company, in an exchange of stock valued at more than $740 million.

title: FOR WINTER BLAHS: PARTY ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON
description: OF all the dismal conditions the human spirit is heir to, not one stands more in need of a party to perk it up than the mid-February blahs. The January thaw has come and gone, leaving behind only the grim expectation that spring may dally not just through March but into April as well. The Super Bowl is past; the doubtful blessing of spring football is yet to come.

title: AETNA LIFE & CASUALTY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONTRIBUTORS TO THE NEEDIEST VOICE CONCERN FOR HOMELESS
description: ''One can't walk down the street (almost any street in the city) without seeing people in need of shelter and food, not to speak of human warmth,'' a note to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund said.

title: ISRAEL COALITION IN DISARRAY, WITH PARTIES SPLIT ON SHARON
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin's governing coalition was thrown into disarray today by the state commission's findings that Defense Minister Ariel Sharon and top army officers, indirectly responsible for the Beirut massacre of Palestinians by Lebanese Phalangists, should resign or be dismissed.

title: SPRAINS, STRAINS AND OTHER MOTION AILMENTS
description: SARAH was rushing to her seat at the ballet when she missed a step, lost her balance and turned her ankle. Within moments the pain was severe enough for her to abandon all thoughts of seeing the performance. The house physician sent her to the emergency room of a nearby hospital where a bad sprain was diagnosed. Three weeks later, her ankle is still painful and swollen, forcing her to walk with a cane.

title: REPORT HIGHLIGHTS PHALANGISTS' ROLE
description: The report of the Israeli commission of inquiry into the killings in the Palestinian camps in Beirut contains new details of the events of September and of the workings of the Christian Phalangists who carried out the operation.

title: THE PRESIDENT'S ERROR
description: To the Editor:

title: Safety Moves in Japan
description: Boxers who are knocked out in bouts in Japan will have to rest for at least 45 days before fighting there again, the Japan Boxing Commission said today. The new safety measures, which take effect March 1, also provide for brain scans to be performed in certain cases on boxers suffering knockouts.

title: WHAT A CAREER MEANS
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: ''Mothers Who Shift Back From Jobs to Homemaking'' was one of the most gratifying articles I've read in recent times. In the past few years women have been bombarded with the concept of putting a career first and have experienced the downplay and negation of motherhood.

title: Let's take a frank look at the world and define a realistic objective in dealing with the Soviet Union. Should our goal be to bring about the end of the Soviet system and erase all economic and political differences between our nations? Or should it be to influence Soviet conduct so that we can both co-exist while pursuing peaceful competition?
description: The latter is our only realistic course. We must design policies that not only show the Soviet Union what it could lose in war, but also what it can gain in peace.

title: TO ILLUSTRATE A LICENSE
description: To the Editor: Your Feb. 1 editorial about photos on driver's licenses makes sense.

title: STORAGE TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a gain of $1,411,000 from the repurchase of debentures

title: EG&G INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Bridge: Monkeying Around Fools Your Opponents at Times
description: Monkeying about at the bridge table usually amounts to antisocial behavior and must be deplored. But it can be done in a technical way that excites admiration from everyone except the victims.

title: CP NATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Argentine Team Set
description: The United States is scheduled to meet Argentina in the first round of the Davis Cup tennis tournament, and Argentina yesterday named its four-man team: Guillermo Vilas, Jose-Luis Clerc, Alejandro Ganzabal and Gustavo Tiberti. The United States captain, Arthur Ashe, named his players last week.

title: CITY JOINS STATE IN FIGHT FOR AID FOR MENTALLY ILL
description: The city and the state yesterday filed a class-action lawsuit against the Federal Government charging that more than 5,200 mentally disabled New Yorkers had been illegally cut off from disability insurance benefits since 1980.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Udall Expected to Say He Won't Run in 1984
description: Representative Morris K. Udall of Arizona has decided not to seek the Democratic Presidential nomination in 1984, sources close to him said tonight. He appeared to hint at such a decision in a speech to a group of college students tonight, referring to his 1976 campaign and said: ''It was a good experience.

title: BUCKEYE FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Including an extraordinary credit of $2.4 million from the redemption of bonds

title: ON EIGHTH AVENUE, FISH LOUISIANA-STYLE
description: IT'S a long way from peeling butter beans in a family Creole kitchen in Baton Rouge, La., to running a tiny, standup restaurant on Eighth Avenue with the unlikely name of the Barking Fish, but that's where Arthur DeCuir's odyssey has taken him.

title: DANCE: ERICK HAWKINS OFFERS 'PLAINS DAYBREAK'
description: WHEN the curtain rises on ''Plains Daybreak,'' one of Erick Hawkins's most beautiful dance works, there are no dancers onstage. And yet one can hardly call the stage bare, so strong is the sense of activity about to begin.

title: NORLIN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-After income from discontinued operations of $1,399,000 for the qr and $6,741,000 for the yr and a loss from sale of discontinued operations of $3,199,000 for the qr and yr...C-Net income after income from discontinued operations of $5,373,000 for the qr and $23,207,000 for the yr, a gain on sale of discontinued oper of $14,423,000 for the qr and yr and an extraordinary credit of $4,140,000 forthe qr and yr

title: Team America Starts Training
description: After a week's delay, the training camp for Team America opened yesterday in Tampa, Fla, with 22 players on hand for the first workout under Coach Alkis Panagoulias.

title: Columbia Pictures Chief Leaving to Form Unit
description: Frank Price, chairman and chief executive of Columbia Pictures, said that he plans to quit in June to become an independent producer. ''During five very successful years at the head of a motion picture studio, you learn a certain amount,'' Mr. Price said. ''With that background, the best thing you can have financially, if you know how to produce hits, is your own production agreement.''

title: LIBERTY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Net loss after a loss of $11.8 million from discontinued operations...C-Aftera loss of $960,000 from discontinued operations...D-After a loss of $13.2 million from discontinued operations

title: 100,000 Mexicans in U.S.  Lose Immunity Status
description: More than 100,000 Mexicans living in the United States have lost their temporary immunity from deportation, but mass explusions are not expected, a spokesman for the Immigration and Naturalization Service says.

title: E.P.A COUNSEL ACCUSED OF IMPEDING INQUIRY
description: The general counsel to the Environmental Protection Agency was accused by a House subcommittee chairman today of violating the law by seeking to impede a Congressional investigation.

title: Argentina Gets More Jets
description: Argentina took delivery recently of about 20 more Mirage III fighter-bombers, bringing to more than 70 the number it has bought since the conflict with Britain over the Falkland Islands last year, diplomatic sources said today.

title: A Recruiting Story
description: Sam Perkins was a good high school basketball player, and among the colleges that recruited him was San Francisco.

title: Polish Defectors in Sweden
description: A Polish military helicopter carrying two soldiers seeking asylum landed on Tarno Island in southern Sweden today, the police said.

title: U.S. AIDES FEEL IF SHARON LEAVES, BEGIN MAY SHOW MORE FLEXIBILITY
description: Key White House and State Department officials privately expressed the hope today that the findings of the Israeli commission would lead to the departure of Defense Minister Ariel Sharon and new negotiating flexibility on the part of Prime Minister Menachem Begin.

title: RANDOM HOUSE ADDS IMPRINT
description: Random House Inc., which includes hardcover book publishers Random House, Alfred A. Knopf and Pantheon Books, has established yet another hardcover imprint, to be called Villard Books.

title: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 1983; The Economy
description: Congress should reduce future budget deficits by repealing or delaying various tax cuts due to take effect after 1983, Dan Rostenkowski, the chief Democratic tax writer in the House, said. He would forgo indexing of tax brackets for inflation and proposed cuts in estate, crude oil, tobacco and telephone taxes. He acknowledged that he could not muster support to repeal the 10 percent cut in income taxes due to take effect July 1. (Page A1.)

title: Market Place; Are Hostile Bids Helpful?
description: EIGHT and a half years ago, Inco Ltd. made an unfriendly attempt to take over ESB Inc., then the world's largest battery producer. ESB refused, turning to the United Aircraft Corporation (now United Technologies) to raise the stakes. Inco bounced back with a still higher offer and landed the prize it sought.

title: SALVADORAN RIGHTIST SAYS HE'LL QUIT TOP POST
description: The President of El Salvador's Constituent Assembly said today that if the constitution is completed he will resign April 22, the same day he took office a year ago.

title: SUNDSTRNAD CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: B-Includes a gain of $5,300,000 from the sale of the company's life insurance subsidiary

title: LANDMARKS PANEL PERMITS OWNER TO RAZE SYNAGOGUE
description: The Landmarks Preservation Commission yesterday gave the owner of the former Mount Neboh Synagogue on West 79th Street permission to raze the building.

title: GREEN PORK IN IOWA? REALLY?
description: There were some red faces at the annual banquet of the Plymouth County Pork Producers Association, for growers touting the goodness of pork saw all their chops turn green.

title: STATUE AND FLAG VOTED FOR VIETNAM MEMORIAL
description: Forced to decide between warring veterans, the Government's Fine Arts Commission voted today to place a statue of soldiers and a flag by the side of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial rather than between its black granite walls.

title: Cadillac Fairview
description: The Cadillac Fairview Corporation said it had received a $1.2 million mortgage payment on the 11,000 apartment units it sold to the Greymac Credit Corporation in November for $270 million. Cadillac took a second mortgage worth $113 million in the deal, and third mortgages were provided by three trust companies, Greymac Trust, Seaway Trust and Crown Trust, which were seized by the Ontario government on Jan. 7. These mortgages, totaling $152 million, fell into default after payments of $3.3 million were not received for December and January.

title: BEVERLY ENTERPRISES reports earnings for QTr to Dec 31
description: Shr earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid Feb 2

title: No Headline
description: AROUND THE WORLD; Poland Links Amnesty To Domestic Stability

title: PHILADELPHIA SUBURBAN CORP reports earnings for QTr to Dec 31
Frazier Triumphs
description: Marvis Frazier, son of the former heavyweight champion Joe Frazier, came back from a 17-month layoff tonight to knock out Amos Haynes in the fifth round of a scheduled 10-round heavyweight bout.

title: ONE SENATOR'S ONE-MAN INVESTIGATION
description: The spacious lobby of the Hotel Flora, a few steps from the congested Via Veneto, has been the temporary office of Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato for the last five days. With aides, journalists and Italian officials in tow, the New York Republican has conducted a one-man investigation into the shooting of Pope John Paul II.

title: Burlington Gets El Paso Stock
description: Burlington Northern Inc. said it had accepted for payment 21 million shares of the El Paso Company's common stock under terms of its $600 million takeover offer. The offer and its proration deadline expired at midnight Monday, which means no further El Paso shares can be submitted to Burlington Northern for payment.

title: National Ad Campaign Starts for Avon Jewelry
description: Classy ads running in 11 women's magazines mark the beginning of Avon's first sustained national advertising for jewelry from its Avon Products subsidiary. The company diversified into the field seven years ago.

title: GOODYEAR TIRE & RUBBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CROSS, A T, CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SENTRY INQUIRY LEADS TO $1 MILLION
description: A green plastic garbage bag stuffed with about $1 million has been found in the home of relatives of one of the suspects in the theft of $11 million from a Bronx armored-car company, the Federal Bureau of Investigation said yesterday.

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: A New Bank for Ohio
description: The Citizens Fidelity Corporation, a Kentucky bank holding company, said today that it had received approval from the Comptroller of the Currency to start a limited-purpose bank in Cincinnati.

title: Universal Health
description: Universal Health Services Inc., a hospital-management company based in Philadelphia, said it planned to buy Qualicare Inc., which owns and operates 15 hospitals, including four specializing in psychiatric care. Universal did not disclose the price it would pay for Qualicare, but estimates put Qualicare's value in excess of $100 million. Alan B. Miller, chairman and president of Universal, said the aquisition would give the company gross annual revenues of more than $400 million and would allow it to enter the field of psychiatric care.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Topping Out on 5th Ave.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Equality in Shelters

title: For Roman Gabriel, A Chance to Learn
description: Roman Gabriel could throw a football 70 yards into a receiver's lap while three defensive linemen clutched at his body, a body that Vince Lombardi once described as ''a big telephone pole.''

title: Lava Flows From Volcano
description: Mount St. Helens continued to pump thick, pasty lava into its crater today but bad weather kept scientists from landing on the mountain's smoky dome to assess the situation. Monitoring devices in the crater showed that the relatively mild eruption that began Monday was continuing.

title: ADMIRED AND DERIDED, AGEE SURGED TO THE TOP
description: For most of his fast-paced career, William M. Agee has been perceived as a gambler, a man who enjoyed taking a flier and usually won. But the 45-year-old chairman and chief executive of the Bendix Corporation pushed his luck hard when he tried to acquire Martin Marietta last summer, and yesterday, in resigning from the presidency of the Allied Corporation, Bill Agee cashed in his chips.

title: MUSIC: THE PHILADELPHIA, WITH ARRAU
description: AGE does not necessarily sanctify. In that respect at least, musicians are not unlike the rest of humankind. However, among the most celebrated performers there seem to be remarkably many who continue to be masters of their craft well past what in most fields would be considered mandatory retirement time. Claudio Arrau is one of these durable phenomena, a pianist who at 80 has lost little if any of his famous dexterity and command of the instrument. Mr. Arrau, who had a birthday last week, gave a cultivated, magisterial performance of the Beethoven Fourth Concerto last night at Carnegie Hall with the Philadelphia Orchestra under Riccardo Muti's baton.

title: WESCO FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
News Summary; WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 9, 1983
description: International Israel's top leaders were criticized by the special state investigating commission in Jerusalem. The panel said that both civilian and military leaders bore ''indirect responsibility'' for the massacre of Palestinians by Lebanese Christian militiamen in Beirut and recommended the resignation or dismissal of Defense Minister Ariel Sharon and three senior generals. The commission's report, issued after a four-month investigation, also criticized Prime Minister Menachem Begin. (Page A1, Column 6.) The Israeli report confirmed for the first time the name of the Christian Phalangist officer in charge of the operation in which the Palestinians were massacred - Elias Hobeika, the head of Phalangist intelligence. The report also revealed that Israel's Chief of Staff, Lieut. Gen. Rafael Eytan, later made a personal appeal to Phalangist commanders to admit their guilt and to try to publicly explain their behavior. (A1:5.)

title: The Doonesbury Party
description: John Anderson is toying with his reputation. For a time in 1980, he was America's favorite underdog. Many people unhappy with the major party nominees cheered when the silver-haired, rock-solid moderate challenged them in the Presidential campaign.

title: RORER GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Yr-ago results are restated to include the acquisition of Cilco Inc

title: Oldsmobile Dealer Ads
