title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Whimsy and Hamantaschen

title: U.S. APPEALS COURT: SEPARATING THE SIGNIFICANT FROM THE TRIVIAL
description: To the Editor:

title: GROUP SEEKS TO SPARE BOY JAIL
description: A group of residents has started a campaign to keep 16-year-old Richard Jahnke out of prison for killing his father, an Internal Revenue Service agent who, according to court testimony, abused his children.

title: Iraq Says Its Planes Raided Iranian Targets in the South
description: Iraq said today that its planes had raided Iranian positions in the southeast and other military targets inside Iran ''inflicting heavy losses in men and equipment.''

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Waffling in the 'Village'

title: Buffalo Beaten
description: The College of New Rochelle captured the state women's Division III basketball title today with a 74-50 victory over Buffalo. The winners advanced to the first round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association regional tournament at a site to be determined.

title: Lynn Harrell Masses Cellos for Villa-Lobos
description: Of the nine friends Lynn Harrell brought along to Alice Tully Hall on Sunday afternoon, seven were fellow cellists. This veritable feast of cello music was apparently inspired by a desire to perform Villa-Lobos's ''Bachianas Brasileiras'' No. 5 for soprano and eight cellos.

title: GOVERNOR WANTS TO STOP GIVING ALL ALASKANS YEARLY CHECKS FROM OIL FUND
description: With a new Governor in office and the world price of oil dropping, the days of carefree visits to the cash drawer may be drawing to a close for those in the Alaska state government.

title: Advertising; Hot-Selling 'M*A*S*H' Air Spots
description: THE final, well-publicized episode of ''M*A*S*H,'' running tonight for two and a half hours on CBS, is truly a media event that is being awaited with enthusiasm in adland, especially among the buyers of the 35 high-priced 30-second commercial units.

title: The System Brings Technology to the Ritz
description: The System demonstrated up-to-the-minute rock technology in its set Friday at the Ritz. On its album, the System is a two-man band, with David Frank playing keyboards and drum machines and Mic Murphy singing and playing guitar.

title: Marvin & Leonard Signs Gloria Stevens
description: Only a few days after Korey, Kay & Partners announced that it had won the Cardio Fitness Systems account, Marvin & Leonard Advertising in Boston reports that it has become the new agency for the Gloria Stevens Figure Salons.

title: Plea for No Leniency For Broker
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission, in unusually harsh language, has asked a Federal judge to impose the stiffest possible criminal contempt penalty against Gary Lewellyn, a stockbroker who was convicted last year of embezzlement and stock manipulation.

title: TAX HEALTH BENEFITS
description: The Reagan Administration's proposal to limit the amount of taxfree health insurance an employee can receive has been met with the expected avalanche of criticism. Specifically, the President's budget plan would tax health care insurance premiums paid by employers when they exceed $175 a month for a family of four or $70 a month for an individual.

title: Lou Reed Leads Band In Bottom Line Date
description: Lou Reed is at the Bottom Line through tomorrow night, leading the most impressive band he has ever assembled through more than 20 of his best songs. These performances mark Mr. Reed's return to the stage after an absence of several years. He used the time away from performing to write some of the most ingenious and deeply felt songs of his career, and to put together a recording and performing band capable of doing them justice.

title: NIGERIAN REFUGEES' AFRICAN HELPERS
description: To the Editor:

title: CANADIAN SAYS BARBIE BOASTED OF VISITING THE U.S.
description: Klaus Barbie, the former Nazi Gestapo chief accused of having committed war crimes in France, has boasted of having visited several American cities, according to a former Canadian convict who says he became a confidant and biographer of Mr. Barbie in Bolivia.

title: Indoor Heptagonal Won by Harvard
description: Harvard won the men's championship, and Princeton took the women's title today after the second and final day of the 36th indoor Heptagonal track and field championships at Yale's Coxe Cage.

title: Market Place; Hope Stirs the Markets
description: FALLING oil prices and falling interest rates worked their magic on the stock market last week, reinforcing a belief that a body blow has been dealt to inflation.

title: CITY'S POSITION SECURE AS FOCUS OF ART WORLD
description: New York City's position as the capital of the art world seems, at the moment, even more invincible today than it has been in the last 25 years.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: A 'Ceremonial Picketing'

title: Clerk, 16, Is Shot Dead In Bronx Store Holdup
description: A Bronx teen-ager was fatally shot during a weekend robbery by three men armed with handguns at a candy store where the youth worked part time, the police said.

title: The Calendar
description: Monday

title: STAGE: DEBBIE REYNOLDS IN 'WOMAN OF THE YEAR'
description: THROUGH the force of her personality, Lauren Bacall made Broadway's Tess Harding into an imposing, Barbara Walters woman of the world. Raquel Welch played the character as a glamorous Wonder Woman. Debbie Reynolds, the new ''Woman of the Year,'' is the most down-to-earth of the three stars to lead this long-running musical.

title: PEKING AIDE OFF TO SOVIET TO RENEW TALKS
description: Qian Qichen, a Deputy Foreign Minister, left today for the Soviet Union to resume talks aimed at establishing more normal relations between Moscow and Peking.

title: FRENCH HORN: TUCKWELL AT 92ND ST. Y
description: THERE are few players who manage the cumbersome French horn with the elegance of Barry Tuckwell. At his Saturday night recital at the 92d Street Y, Mr. Tuckwell offered dexterous renditions of material ranging from the early Beethoven to the later Messiaen.

title: PANEL URGES PREPARATIONS TO MEET BIG DEMAND FOR GENETIC SCREENING
description: A Presidential ethics commission urged the nation today to prepare counseling services and make other arrangements to meet a likely ''huge demand'' for genetic screening tests to determine whether parents are likely to have defective children.

title: WILLIAMS IS MOURNED BY FRIENDS AND OTHERS
description: Some were weeping, some fought back tears. Others stood silently for long periods looking at Tennessee Williams's coffin. All day yesterday, people from the theater and other admirers paid homage to the playwright, whose body was on view at the Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home.

title: Bridge: The Defense Will Be Wise To Keep Declarer Ignorant
description: Thanks to clues provided by the bidding, the defenders often know a great deal more about the distribution than the declarer does. In such situations some cunning may be called for: If the declarer is in the dark, he should be kept there. A subtle example is the diagramed deal from the recent Grand National Pair Championship.

title: ANGOLA IS REPORTED WILLING TO RESUME PARLEY ON NAMIBIA
description: Angola is ready to resume talks with South Africa on independence for South-West Africa, or Namibia, despite the cutting short of negotiations last week, Angola's Interior Minister said Saturday.

title: ...WHILE NKOMO SAYS HE IS A VIRTUAL PRISONER
description: Joshua Nkomo, the Zimbabwean opposition leader accused by Prime Minister Robert Mugabe of plotting a coup, charged today that the police had placed him under ''virtual house arrest'' inside his fenced bungalow.

title: SALVADOR REGIME ACTS SWIFTLY TO INVESTIGATE SLAYING REPORT
description: The peasants said they were in their thatched huts, preparing for the day, when at 6:30 last Tuesday morning three truckloads of soldiers arrived in Las Hojas, a farming cooperative run by Indians in the province of Sonsonate.

title: CITY SEEKING RISE IN RIKERS INMATES
description: New York City officials are to appear in Federal District Court today to argue that the city be allowed to house more inmates on Rikers Island because conditions there have improved.

title: CONSTANTIN ANDERSON
description: Constantin Anderson, a cartographer and head of Anderson Isometric Maps of Manhattan, died Monday of a heart attack at Cabrini Medical Center.

title: REAGAN TO DISCUSS SALVADOR AID
description: President Reagan has asked Congressional leaders to a meeting at the White House on Monday to discuss a proposal for an extra $60 million in military aid for El Salvador, a White House aide said today.

title: Swiss Team Wins Four-Man Bobsled
description: Ekkehard Fasser, the latest in a long series of dominant Swiss drivers, won the world four-man bobsled championship today with a record four-heat time of 3 minutes 57.24 seconds.

title: THE COST TO ADULTS OF SUB-MINIMUM PAY
description: To the Editor:

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: When was Colgate's football team unbeaten, untied, unscored upon and uninvited to the Rose Bowl, which was then an open event? Please list the scores of all the games that season and the name of the coach.
